text:
Best tasting bagels in Arizona and of anywhere that I have tried in the world.  The owner makes you feel like family.  My son loves to go too.  
My staple - bagel breakfast sandwich with lox.

Cozy soup Nazi vibe in effect, no frills but best bagels in town. Ordered coffee to go w/ honey wheat Bfast bagel eggs,cheese,sausage. Best 5$ investment. 

I was curious & asked the guy @the counter "what type of sausage" was included in the bagel & received very informative "sausage" answer...  Classic.

Delicious bagels, I got two of the sliced lox ones and I was talking to the owner. He said I will love it and that I will come back again, he's right I will 100% be back . It's hard to find bagel places that have lox in Arizona and I'm glad I found this place

Like whoa.  Best bagels in Arizona.  No question.

Bagels are probably my favorite food.  I take them very seriously.  But I don't eat them very often because most bagels in the Phoenix area are so mediocre it's just not worth it.

Bagel Man bagels are incredible.  We went there on Saturday to pick up a dozen and the everything bagels had just come out of the oven.  OMG.  Fresh, piping hot, soft, flavorful - PERFECT.  And the veggie cream cheese is also amazing.

I wish we lived closer but then I might eat 5 bagels a day.  Maybe it's good we're a few miles away.  

Can't wait to go back.  Oh and I love The Bagel Man himself - he's legit.
Best bagel I've had in AZ! With fresh, yummy jalepeno cream cheese. Just what I was looking for!
Try "The Boss" it is so nice on a warm summer day. Fresh mozzarella with Roasted red pepper and olive oil. Excellent sandwich! Finally a great family owned bagel shop in the southeast valley!

This place has ruined bagels for me for the rest of my life. They set the bar pretty freakin high! It's a pretty small establishment with limited seating, I recommend taking it to-go. Service is good and the owner is friendly. There have been times that certain bagel flavors have sold out due to high demand, but within 15-30 minutes they usually have another batch made if youre picky.
Blueberry Bagel is fresh yummy bagel heaven. Thanks Bagel man.
Little hole in the wall. Wonderful fresh New York style breakfast bagels. If it were closer I would probably go every single morning

Amazing bagels made for you by amazing employees. They are so quick and very friendly. Great customer service!! They even allow call ahead pick up. I gave 4 stars only because they are not open Monday's though and the place is a little small so when there is a line you feel crunched or in the way of everyone else. Did I mention the bagels are amazing?

We've been here a handful of times now, and continue to fall in love every time.

The bagels are the best we've ever had, and are paired with amazing meats and cheeses.

I've never had a bagel in New York, but I'm hopeful that this is what everybody is talking about. It's certainly what we're talking about!
Really good and fresh bagels.  Nice people too.  Plan to sit outside- the inside is tight and functional only.  You will appreciate the good food, not the atmosphere.

There is no better place for a bagel in this dry desert town than The Bagel Man.  You can close your eyes and smell the traffic out on the NYC street.  It's a little musty and stuffy from the bagel steam (or the swamp cooler).  You hear the friendliness of the Bagel Man himself, welcoming you in and wishing you well on your way.  And then you taste the warm, crust and soft insider of a fantastic bagel and cream cheese.   Perfection.
Great service, great taste and perfect product...try a Bialy they are the best!
The best in town! Nice big serving of tasty lox, capers, tomato, cream cheese.....wonderful! The only place I will go for my bagels. Super friendly people w great food and great service!

Have fun selecting your favorite flavors knowing that The Bagel Man makes bagels that are better than you will find elsewhere around town.  This makes all the difference.  I have had more fancy styles on the east coast, but I haven't had better bagels.  Try the olive spread.
Absolutely the best Bagels I have EVER had!  LOVE-LOVE-LOVE this  place, only wish they were closer to my house!

You move from NY and miss the bagels..of all things. 
Best bagels in Arizona. Equally as good as, if not better than, a lot of NY bagel places. Sometimes there are no bagels left by 11 am, but it seems like lately they have been stocked if I get there around that time. Everything is good; nothing is bad. I usually get tuna. Really good cream cheese, too. Everything I have ever gotten there has been good. Bagels freeze well, too.
Owner is nice and will always say hi and ask about family. Some of the newer guys working there are...new....let's say.
Go early and often!

The Bagel Man has the best everything bagels I have ever eaten.  I go there for lunch a couple times a week.  I enjoy the Boar's Head deli meats as well.  Cal is there every day and always greets me with a smile and knows exactly what I like.  Glad to see that since it has only been open a few months that he always has customers in there.  I love to see the community supporting the small businesses in the area.
The best bagels in AZ. My favorite is the Loks bagel minus the onions on a toasted everything bagel. Cal and his cree have this down perfectly.

Nice folks working the lunch shift and keeping on top of everything, including keeping the place clean. 

The bagels had a nice crust and flavor, but it feels like they might not have adjusted the recipe for warmer summer temps yet. The bagels we got were on the pillowy side, maybe having had too much rise. I'd like more chew and density from a place with NYC pedigree.

I've always loved bagel sandwiches for breakfast and am so glad I found this place on Yelp! I've been to The Bagel Man twice now for a bacon, egg, and cheese on everything and both times it was excellent! I just moved to Tempe a month ago, but don't think I'll even bother trying other bagel shops. This one already has my heart with its bagel perfection and timely / friendly service.
Delicious bagel sandwiches.  They do not cut corners and give you proper amount of each topping.

I love this place,  I feel like I'm back east walking into a bagel shop... This is the real deal. For all the people that think Einsteins Bagels are good... Come experience what a real bagel and bagel shop is... and you NEVER toast a bagel!

I love this place! I live just down the street to I'm typically here every weekend. I love their breakfast sandwiches. My boyfriend & I have breakfast here or take it to go. The boys are always nice & very fast in making your food. I absolutely do recommend.

This place rocks!!  ...especially if you're used to east coast bagels!   Where else can you get 2 bacon egg and cheese breakfast bagel sandwiches plus a large drink big enough for two and all for $9!!  Plus they use Boar's Head bacon there...so it's not that thin nasty bacon you find elsewhere. Their everything bagels are the best in town. I highly recommend this place and it's worth waiting if there's a line. The owner and workers are all friendly, which makes for a good atmosphere.  My only complaint is that they need more tables ...maybe they should buy the sub shop next to them and expand.

Im not a big fan of bagels since I'm used to the stored bought kind like Sarah Lee and Costco brand.  I think in general bagels are thick and doughy.   Starbucks, Einstein bagels are the same in my opinion.  However I found bagel man on yelp as I was looking for a breakfast joint.  I'll have to admit The bagels are the best in town as they are made fresh everyday.  I had the lox onion bagel with cream cheese scallions and my husband had the works on a garlic bagel.   That's was the beginning of my bagel addiction.  I come atleast twice a week and get the breakfast bagel that comes with bacon, egg and cheese.  They have a variety of bagels to choose from and I've had a few and they all taste great.  Go get yours today!

Note to self:  Don't look at Bagel Man on Yelp when you're hungry.

First tried the Bagel Man after a coworker brought in bagels one morning and I demanded to know where these heavenly bagels were prepared.  He pointed me to The Bagel Man, which happens to be close to my house.

I drug my husband here one Saturday morning for bagel sandwiches.  We walked out with a ham, egg and cheese everything bagel and a sausage egg and cheese everything bagel.  We ordered a couple of extra bagels to go as well and enjoyed them at home.

The restaurant itself is tiny, packed, and hot on a Saturday morning, but the service was quick and the bagels are worth it!

I don't normally try little places like this, but I'm so glad I did (thanks to the other reviews on here)! It was a small little shop in a shopping plaza, with several two-person tables. As I was waiting, several other obviously regular customers came in, and the owner automatically knew what each of them wanted. Very friendly. I got a bacon, egg, and cheese everything bagel, and my two small kids shared a blueberry bagel with cream cheese. I tried a bite of theirs, and it was really good...the cream cheese was clearly handmade and delicious. My bagel was also absolutely amazing. They put plenty of each food on it, and good quality ingredients. The bagel itself was delicious and a perfect texture. Around $6 for the two bagels. Any time we are in Phoenix again, we will definitely be going here.

One of the best bagels and spread I've ever had. The salmon spread had chunks of salmon in it and was delicious. Coffee cake is excellent as well. Coffee was ok, but the bagel made up for it. I'll be back when I'm in Phoenix.

Just off the boat from NYC looking for a good bagel saw reviews thought I would give it a try they are ok nothing special about it maybe its the best in the area like I said just off the boat but not worth my 40 min round trip drive will keep looking

Best bagels I've ever had!  Made the right way with a huge selection of cream cheeses and sandwiches!  Loved it!!  My husband had the bagel and lox and it was perfectly prepared with red onion and capers.

I picked up a bakers dozen for the coworkers today, we are all in agreement, the best bagels around! These have the perfect chewy crust and soft fluffy center. Very nice selections of spreads as well. I highly recommend!

Just stopped in for my first bagel from The Bagel Man...WOW! I'm confident in saying this was the best bagel I've ever had. I had the everything bagel, toasted, with their scallion cream cheese on the side. First of all, they put toppings on both sides of the bagel, which is awesome! No more debating which half of the bagel to eat first (I'm looking at you, Einsteins everything bagel!) Second, the bagel was perfectly baked, slightly crunchy outside, moist and chewy inside. And the scallion cream cheese was the icing in the delicious bagel cake. I also spoke to the extremely friendly owner, and I'm so glad to hear that business is going well for him. The only trouble with this place is it's very close to my office, and I'm afraid of all the money I'm going to be spending here!
There is no better bagel place! Kal knows what he is doing and there is no comparison with the other places around. The only time I go to another bagel place is on Monday when they are closed!
First time here last Saturday, got the egg, ham and cheese on a jalapeño bagel with cream cheese. It's a really good value and the bagel was one of the best I've had. I'll definitely be coming back.

This is BY FAR my favorite place for breakfast. I wish I was exaggerating. My boyfriend and I go here several times a week. Great bagels. Quick service. Wonderful people. They are always so friendly and it is just a great way to start the day.

We ordered a breakfast sandwich (egg and cheese), The Sexy, and one with plain cream cheese. We only tried the jalapeno bagel for all three. Very impressed. The bagels were soft and warm and the perfect density. 

There was a line almost out the door around 11am on a Saturday morning. The line went very fast and we were eating in no time. 

Bagel was still good the next day after being refrigerated. 

Highly recommend if you love mom and pop shops.

This place is amazing. I don't know that I have ever had a truly authentic bagel until visiting The Bagel Man. The owner, Kal, is so nice and friendly. He introduced himself to me and my husband and when I went back the next day with a friend, he remembered my name. Great service, food and the coffee is great too. I usually don't expect great coffee from the carafes but their coffee went great with my bagel breakfast sandwich. My only complaint was that it was a little hot in there, but combined with the fact that we live in Arizona and the big ovens, I'm going to have to cut them some slack. Great place and new favorite bagel spot!
Love this place! The bagels are homemade and the owner and staff are super friendly...been going for a few years now and no other bagel compares!

The bagels are great here. I usually end up getting a toasted wheat or sesame seed bagel with veggie cream cheese. The owner said he visited AZ six years ago and couldn't get a good bagel so he made it his mission to open another bagel shop (his family has one in NJ). I'm glad he did. 

Good food, good prices, good place.
Best Bagels in the Valley!!!  Very authentic and delicious.  The owner, Cal, is so very kind, friendly and always happy.

I stopped in this morning for a breakfast bagel sandwich, I found this place randomly on yelp and since it has such great reviews I thought I'd give it a try! 

It is your typical hole in the wall shop that offers up some delicious fresh bagels! I ordered the egg and lox breakfast sandwich. I ordered it on a toasted everything bagel that was absolutely fantastic with the lox, tomato and chive cream cheese! The scrambled egg was sub par but I expected it to be. The bagels are far exceeding your typical Einsteins bagel and I would recommend a stop by The Bagel Man to anyone!

Hands down the best bagel in Arizona.  Hands down the best bagel sandwiches in Arizona.  So fresh they make you angry at all of the time you wasted eating at Einstein's.  So reasonably priced they make you wonder why you don't come here everyday.  

Crackly crust, tender dough, toppings on both sides of the bagel.  Perfection.

Very, very good. 

This place could be a selling point when convincing New Yorkers to move to the Phoenix area. 

This makes my top two bagel places, the other one being an older bagel shop in NYC. I got a [fresh] everything bagel with lox spread, and it was a highlight of my day. 

The staff were very courteous and attentive, and provided excellent service.

In sum, you can keep reading Yelp reviews, or you can go and experience it for yourself. I suggest the latter.

This is my favorite bagel place!
The bagels are soooooo damn delicious. They are crispy on the outside and so chewy on the inside. They are by far much larger than other bagels from anywhere else, like Einstein Bagels. I usually need to eat 3 or 4 of Einstein Bagels to get full (and I'm a little 5'4 120lb girl), and just 1 or 2 of the Bagel Man's bagels are more than enough to fill me up.
The owner is so sweet and remembers you after you show up once. He always asks how I've been and remembers details from last time, he is so friendly. The second you walk in the door he will greet you.
As for what was said by that negative review below, that isn't true at all. The place is clean and smells wonderfully of freshly baked bagels. There are other workers who have rang me up before, and were very friendly with it.
The only thing I could find negative at all about this place was that its slightly warm inside, but that's just because they are baking bagels all day!
Every time I am in Phoenix I stop by and get some of their bagels! They are great to eat after a morning workout. Sometimes when I stop by at the end of the day, I get a couple free bagels with my order. I would definitely recommend stopping by, and trying the egg bagel especially!

I love this place! Cal is very sweet and so is his staff. They make a point to ask your name and seem genuinely happy to see you. The breakfast bagels are amazing (eggs, cheese, bacon mmmmm). Unlike other bagel places, they don't use a microwave to cook your breakfast. It does get packed on the weekends and others days, they may already be out of your favorite bagel type. That to me just means I've gotta get out of bed earlier. :) We'd be here at least weekly if I said "Yes." every time my 11 year old asks, "Can we get Bagel Man?". It takes a lot of self control to keep driving when I pass iron the way to work each day. :)

Real bagels. Not rolls shaped like bagels you usually get in Arizona. I grew up in Detroit. I missed bagels from back East . . . Until the arrival of The Bagel Man. The owner has an original shop back in Jersey. That should say it all about authenticity. 

If you want a real bagel, check this place out. Never understood why people from the East love bagels?  One visit here will explain it.

First time here and I was greeted with smiles and warm fresh bagels.  Hole in the wall place, very small and cozy. Bagels were delicious and soft! You have to try the homemade cream cheese spread. It was amazing. I found my new bagel joint!

Bagel Man's rudeness exceeds his lack of business sense.   When trying to buy 6 pumpernickel, 6 whole wheat, and some egg bagels, Bagel Man snapped "My bagels are expensive and you will be taking them away from my other customers."  What's that all about?   Isn't Bagel Man in the business to make and sell bagels?  When presenting a coupon to buy a dozen and get 3 free (which we've used many times) we were told that the coupon was counterfeit and he did not want to honor it, but did so with a growl of anger.

Another problem is the inconsistency of the bagels.  Sometimes they are dry and when cut, have air holes.   Sometimes they are uneven with rather large holes and misshapen.  Sometimes they have a crusty outside like they have been egg washed.  I've actually cut one and the whole outside crust fell off, leaving very little bagel left. The place is dirty and tables and floor are speckled with crumbs. 
 
Bagel Man should be baking enough bagels to satisfy all his customers, not scold them for ordering them.  We have given up on Bagel Man.

Tried it for the first time today.  Yelp has never failed me and this was no different. The owner was super friendly and welcoming. The everything bagel with cream cheese and sliced lox was awesome.  Will definitely be back.

My husband and I were on the hunt for a good + local bagel place..and we found this little gem yesterday!! The owner is so personable, and so is everyone who works here. Something tells me we're going to be here every weekend!
Best breakfast bagel sandwich I ever had!

Went here for Sunday breakfast around 11am. The wait was not long and the bagels we ordered were fantastic; fresh and authentic. Prices are reasonable-paid ~$16 for 3 breakfast sandwiches, a bagel w/ cream cheese, and 2 drinks. Highly recommend as an area source of nourishment!!
When a New York City native tells you this is a AUTHENTIC bagel shop, you have done many things right! Love this place.

I got an egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel.  The bagel was a bit to garlic salty for me but I'm sure most other Americans would love it.  the bagel was like a fresh baguette; crispy on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside.  The simple sandwich was good but I will get a different type of bagel next time.
This place is fast and fairly priced. The garlic bagel I had was so fresh! I'm not going to anymore chains!
I love the bagel man! Such a nice group of workers. Super fast and still friendly. Bagels are amazing!!!
This place was awesome!!! It was recommended by a friend. It was my first time there, I ordered the breakfast bagel with lox and tomatoes!! Dayum dayum dayum!!!!!
The best bagels in Phoenix! The staff seem like great people too. We will definitely be back!

This is my morning stop every weekday. Best bagels in town, staff is incredibly friendly and the owner loves his business. I am a regular and I can't imagine changing that habit anytime soon. My personal favorite is the salted bagel preferably right out of their ovens.

Outstanding bagels, great service.

A bagel joint in Phoenix deserves credit just for making actual bagels. Some of the popular spots in Phoenix -- e.g. Chompie's -- don't make real bagels. They're just "rolls with holes", just common bread. A bagel is distinctive in its chewy texture and unique flavor.

For reference, Einsteins and Back East Bagels will give you real bagels, far better than Chompie's. Bagel Man is better still. They don't just make real bagels -- they make good bagels. Best I've had anywhere in the Tempe, Ahwatukee, Mesa, Chandler area.
I just found this place and it is very good.  The cream cheese is great and the bagels are delicious.
What an amazing bagel! I had a ham, egg and cheese sandwich on a plain bagel and made "nom nom nom" sounds during every bite. I will be coming here every time I am in the neighborhood.
Simply the best.  Nothing else needs to be said.  You will not be disappointed. One visit and you will be hooked.

The bagels were good, maybe a bit too salty that day.  The staff was nice but they all seemed to be new so the logistics were still being worked out.  Atmosphere is lacking inside or out.  Room for improvement.

I love this place. It is the ONLY place I will buy bagels from. When I moved from NY to AZ over a decade ago, I failed to anticipate that the every day staples of food I grew up with exist in very limited supply out here. My every-Sunday-morning-breakfast consisted of a bagel w/ cream cheese and some smoked salmon. Throw in a cup of coffee, the morning paper, and you have my perfect Sunday morning. Fast forward to me residing in AZ; where are the bagels at?! No, I don't mean rolls that are shaped like donuts (most places that sell "bagels" like Chompies, Back East Bagels, and other chains that don't do this food justice). I mean big, crusty on the outside, and dense soft dough on the inside bagels. Here is where The Bagel Man comes in. The taste, the texture, and the quality is the closest to anything I grew up with. All of their variety tastes good and fresh. Their staff is very friendly. If you want the best, be there at opening; but if you get there before me, save me some 'Everything', 'Sesame', and 'Onion' bagels. BTW, their smoked salmon/lox with cream cheese actually has chunks of smoked salmon in it versus the other guys who whip their cream cheese to the point that all I see is some pink in my cream cheese. Thank you, The Bagel Man for restoring my Sunday mornings.
A must go if  you like the small cafe style shop. Bagels are fresh in house along with the cream cheese being hand whipped. Don't forget the price,  very affordable. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!
Definitely the best bagels I have had in AZ!  Very fresh and soft, as well as a lot of options to choose from.
Place is legit. Great bagles. Very reasonably priced. Long lines of course, but that just shows how good they are. Don't pass this place up.

I swoon for bagels, I adore them. When the sweet scent of an everything bagel is in the air, my knees buckle. I came to The Bagel Man for the first time I could barely hold my excitement as soon as I saw that rack of bagels. I had to order an everything bagel with lox and cream cheese. I knew I had to, like it was predestined. The rest of that experience was like some sort of heroine high daze that left me craving more. A life long addiction that I'm sure I'll never shake.

This. Place. Was. FILTHY.  Oh my gosh.  It looked like the aftermath of a food fight - bagel chunks and crumbs all over the floor.  I won't get started on the bathroom, it was so disgusting.  

The owner, the Bagel Man himself, was too busy chatting with another employee to greet me or wait on me.  A nice lady from the kitchen had to come out and help.  Apparently though, nobody but the owner is allowed to handle the money so he finally broke off his conversation and rang up the sale.  I didn't like the way he treated the nice lady and I was troubled by the way she seemed overly deferential to him and almost frightened.  

Bagels are okay but nothing special.

Would NOT go back!  If the customer are is that dirty, what can the kitchen be like???
Amazing New York style bagels. Crispy thin crust, soft chewy dough. The breakfast bagel on an everything bagel is the way to go. Friendly service. I'll definitely be back.

Absolutely love The Bagel Man. The owner learned my name after the third visit ha, nicest guy in the world. My girlfriend is from New Jersey and she was dying for a good bagel place. We tried many here in the valley and bagel man is definitely the best. Gotta love that pork roll!

Great prices, fantastic bagels and a very friendly staff. Even at 6 AM on a Sunday morning.

If you want the bagel equivalent of watching your kid graduate from college, go visit the Bagel Man. Your only disappointment will come when you realize that you just ate 13 bagels in one sitting and now you have no leftover bagels. 

But seriously. I ate 13 bagels in one sitting.

I love this place. I come here 3 times a week. The bagels are always fresh the pastrami egg and cheese you need to try one. 

                    Thank you
Delicious fresh bagels, and jalapeño cream cheese... Can't beat that! Oh and very nice staff!!

Two days in Phoenix so far, two days at The Bagel Man.  Outstanding bagels and crumb cake!  Friendly and efficient service, and incredible value.  For $5 and change, I had a gargantuan Egg Bagel with scrambled eggs, cheese and ham, and equally massive crumb cake!  Who needs lunch?!  This will easily last me until dinner.  See you tomorrow - going to give the Onion Bagel a try.  There was a wait for it yesterday!
We love this place!! The secret is out, this is the best bagel place in town. The staff are friendly and fast, the bagels are delicious.

This is the best place to get a bagel in ahwatukee! The bagels are made fresh continuously throughout the day. Everytime I go i get a salt bagel. It is the only place around to get it. It is fast and cheap! Bagel and cream cheese is like $3! 100% recommend!

I come here every weekend and it never disappoints. The staff is so friendly and the food is great. I'm from the east coast and I've spent the last three years looking for a place with authentic bagels. I can never go back to Einsteins after eating here.

This place's bagels are just incredible.  They are fresh, chewy, and made on-site.  I had "The Sexy" which was awesome.  The owner rang me up and was incredibly friendly.  If you love authentic, fresh bagels, this is your place.

Had to check out the place because of the reviews! It didn't WOW me like I was expecting, but they did gain a customer for sure!! The bagels were fresh and you had a multitude of choices.  A must try! Will be going back to try their lunch options! Side note... The Owner and Staff were very nice and attentive!

The Bagel Man is the best! We use him for work lunches as well as breakfast meetings. Support your local eateries and you will be in for a treat. He makes them fresh every morning and they are as delicious as they come. You will love his homemade cream cheeses too. Great prices!

I'll drive 25 minutes out of my way on my way to work to pick up bagels from The Bagel Man. The bagels are the size of my face and the cream cheese is fresh and hand mixed. This place makes makes me want to laugh at Einsteins.

Do you miss NYC and the neighborhood Bagel shop...Well it moved to Phoenix.

Bagels are great with a crust/shell and soft insides, not just browned bread.
Excellent base for Spreads and Sandwiches

Want to support a local business, this seems to be a family run business.

Sandwiches are great  as are the cream cheese spreads, smooth and tasty.

But I think the best part is the owner, welcoming and friendly and he remembers you after you have only been there ONCE.  I think he is from Jersey so it must be Jersey hospitality,,,Great to be welcomed into his business every time you step through the door.

No need to tell you so support local business, go get the best NYC bagel in Phoenix.

Just  happens to be in Awatukee.

Love this place! Great east coast style bagels and I love their lox. 

I would give Bagel Man 5 stars but the guy at the cashier always has a bad attitude. He tends to sigh loudly, roll his eyes and corrects me when ordering. The whole ordering experience is terrible because of him, I feel as though I am a burden to him especially when I have multiple orders for my coworkers and I but at least the owner, the cooks, and the food are always fantastic!
Super fluffy bagel with house-made scallion cream cheese,, lox, tomato, onion, and capers! Yum!

Best bagels in town! Baked fresh everyday. Lots of variety, and several flavors of cream cheese. The breakfast and lunch sandwiches are unique and taste great. Excellent friendly customer service and fun atmosphere. The owner is awesome and so is the staff.

5 stars for the delicious bagels: my fave: Lox sandwich
5 stars for the very affordable prices
5 stars for the supberb service!
Best bagels in AZ! I'm from jersey and this place reminded me of home! They even have Taylor Ham. So happy to have found this place and highly recommend it to all! Just wish they were open Mondays!
This place is a must at least every month. They have some unique offerings. The bagels can get pricey if you add lots on, but simple and plain is always best.

Okay, this place has basically the best bagels I've ever had. They are fresh, delicious, and the perfect size to satisfy the hunger beast without overdoing it. 

We walked in and were greeted by some awesome staff! They were all way nice and helpful with recommendations. As we looked over the menu a few people stopped in that seemed to be regulars, and they knew their names, orders, and asked them about personal things they had done that they obviously had heard about last time. Nice work! That's a touch of customer service many restaurants will never get to.

The bacon breakfast bagel on the salt bagel was delicious! And the everything with the cinnamon walnut spread was amazing. I'm really sad I'm only in town for a day or two or this would be my new weekly go to.
Tried this place before reading any reviews, and to my pleasant surprise, it was wonderful! Wonderful bagels, wonderful people!

I seldom give out 5 Stars but anything less for this bagelmaster would be an injustice.  Unlike bagels back east, these bagels are less doughy and more fluffy on the inside.  The outside has a nice crunch and to top it all off they are probably a half inch larger than your normal bagel.
I had them make me an Everything Bagel, toasted with cream cheese, bacon and egg.  A truly amazing taste experience - not too garlicky, not too salty, just perfection in the form of a boiled piece of dough.  If I lived in Phoenix I would be eating here every weekend.
The only criticism is that the store's A/C doesn't ever seem to be working and so it gets a little warm if you decide to eat on site.  
When I return to Atlanta I will be stopping here before I board the plane to purchase a few to show what a real bagel should be.  
Kudos PHX - the best bagel West of the Mississippi!

I love the bagel man and the staff. Food is great I always get breakfast here when I'm on this side of town sometimes I even drive when I'm not just because I know the quality and service is excellent. I am an everything bagel type of girl with bacon egg and cheese.
Best spot in AZ for real bagels. As a jersey girl, these guys are the real deal. Tastes just like back home. Amazing.
This place is hands-down the best bagels in Arizona. Not only are the bagels perfection, the staff is truly a blessing. I want to go every day! Lol Def a must!!!

I stopped here bc of the pretty good yelp ratting. Yelp reviews can be brutal. Brought these to the office everyone loved them one said the best she ever had. People that are complaining about the softness are correct. They have a crisp outside and very soft inside. I thought they were outstanding by far the best I had in the US for bagel or bread. I moved here from Europe and I have had a hard time finding great bread this is really good. Definitely worth giving a try.

As a Jew, I can appreciate a bagel that's not only delicious but also super cheap. This place has huge, doughy homemade bagels with a variety of homemade cream cheeses. Extra points for the owner being super sweet and accommodating!

I rarely give eateries 5 stars.  Many 4 stars (as I choose them diligently using Yelper's recommendations of course), but 5 stars is a rarity.

I gave The Bagel Man 5 stars for a couple fundamental reasons. 1) The food was delicious at a very reasonable price. 2) They were extremely friendly. Especially the person who I assumed was "the bagel man" himself.  That's it folks.  That's all it takes to earn a 5 star from this guy..... But it's a wonder I can't give out more of them....

I ate the Scrambled egg and lox on an everything bagel. Perfect!  My daughter had the scrambled egg and bacon on a plain bagel.  She said her's was very good also, but I'd have to say I won with my choice. 

We will visit them again tomorrow before heading further north, and I plan on winning again!

Do yourself a flavor and check them out if you're in this hood.
Love this place. I thought Long Island was the only place to get an amazing bacon egg and cheese. Bagels are fantastic!

Found on Yelp, easy to get to. Fun friendly atmosphere, great greeting. Lots of choices, fresh bagels.

Ordered the lox and cream cheese on garlic bagel. 

Hubby had scrambled egg, bacon on garlic bagel.

Bagels were good size, and they did not skimp on ingredients, including the lox, cream cheese, and capers. Most garlic bagels can't taste the garlic. This was spot on. When in Phoenix this will be our look forward to, must stop place.

Very fast service.

Best bagels in Arizona.  Not like those round bread things you get at other places like Einstein bros and such.  Everything with bacon, egg and cheese or blueberry with ham, egg and cheese are delicious!  Go.  You will love this place!

I am from New York. I was born in Brooklyn. My first word was Bagel. This place is fantastic. The staff is super kind and attentive. It would stack up against several places I love back home. 
If you are on a road trip and need breakfast, stop here.
Great bagels, great prices and great service... that's all that needs to be said... and I'm from NY.

The service was great & the food was even better!! We got a bacon, egg and cheese on an everything bagel & the Show Off bagel. Highly recommend! It was also fast so we were in and out in 5 minutes!! Love this place!

This place is delicious! It has authentic New York style bagels and cream cheese. I especially enjoy their onion bagel toasted with veggie cream cheese. Their iced coffee is also top notch. I will be back and will recommend to all my friends and family! Keep it up Bagel Man!! You make my mornings so happy!

Large selection of bagels early in the am.  We went here on a Saturday am because it is the earliest opening bagel shop in the Tuke.  Friendly customer service too along with prices that are a good value.  If you are an early riser, this is the place to go.

The health department need to pay this place a visit.  It was so grouse in my opinion. The guy was sweating and dripping all over the place.  He had a glove on, but was touching everything with his glove plus using his glove hand to take and count back cash.  Then he uses that gloved hand that whipped his brow, touched my money and grabs a handful of bagels.  I took my bagel and dropped it in the trash on the way out.

I was craving bagels that are like in New York, soft and fluffy on the inside but nice golden on top! And I found this place on yelp and it had great reviews so I had to check it out! 
The bagels are amazing here! These are the top bagels that I've had in AZ and they are quite similar to bagels that are in New York! The inside of the bagels were soft and fluffy but had a nice crunch on the outside! There weren't many bagels left for us to get so we got the plain, onion, and the everything bagel with the scallion cream cheese! 
It was so delicious and would have to try their bagel breakfast sandwiches next time!

Seriously, if you're into bagels you MUST come here! Consider it a sacred pilgrimage for all bagel lovers.  The actual "Bagel Man" is always available to greet and assist his loyal flock. He makes bagels once each morning and when they are gone the shop closes, so get here early!  Just thinking about this place makes me want to camp outside until he opens again in the morning. The bagels have a wonderful crisp outside with a sensual chewy inside. I won't even compare them to other "wanna-be" bagel joints in the area because that would be downright disrespectful. He makes a mean bagel sandwich and potato salad too! I almost forgot to mention he makes his own cream cheese spreads too. The store itself isn't full of frills, nor will you find a fancy lounge area because it's not about the shop, it's about the BAGELS! Get them to-go!
Had my first sandwich from the bagel man today. It was really tasty. They make the bagels there at the shop. I will definitely be back.

I just moved here from New York two months ago, so I was extremely skeptical when hearing Bagel Man bagels tasted like back home. I'm happy to report they are easily the closest thing you can get to an authentic New York bagel here in Arizona. Only wish they had egg everything bagels! That's a New York staple, not to mention my favorite.

From the tastes of it, anything you order is going to be delicious. They also "shmear" the bagels in a true New York fashion- aka cream cheese dripping out of every edge.

While I'll still be smuggling egg everything and rainbow bagels from back home in my suitcase when I visit, I'll be a regular here at bagel man. I couldn't be happier to have found this place!

Most scrumptious bagel I've ever had. I got a rich and famous sandwich on a salt bagel and it was excellent. The "bagel man" is so nice and welcoming. Macaroni salad is excellent. All around great experience getting lunch here.

Owner gave my bagel to his buddy who was two people behind me and then gave me the wrong bagel.

Good first impression
Awesome people, great variety will definitely return and recommend. We walked in were greeted by the owner very nice man.

The energy in this place reminded me of why I love small businesses. The owner new regulars by name, caught up with familiar faces that have moved away from the area but stopped by for some bagel goodness.  And the most important aspect was the quality of the food. You can feel the love and expertise that's put into the bagels here. Even though I got the Reuben (excellent choice), I couldn't help but sampling my wife's and Son's bagels. The crispy outside, soft interior, and flavorful cream cheese smear made it a winner!
The Best Bagels HANDS DOWN!!! My sister drives all the way from North Phoenix to get this guys Bagels!!! ;-)

I forgot to mention this but I have not had bagels this good in the west coast, ever! Literally feel like I'm in Stanton Island when I'm sinking teeth in these bagels and these guys definitely are very fast and they know how to run a great operation.

Frankly I thought they were awful, and I'm a bread eater. I could barely eat half. Now, I haven't completely given it the thumbs down because I only tried the bagel and the other stuff on the menu looks kind of good. I will update if and IF I ever come back. Now, as for the numerous people mentioning New Jersey. These are supposed to be NY bagels. Why is anyone mentioning Jersey. Once and for all! Jersey is not and never will be NYC. And I don't know where the rest of you are from in NY. Long Island perhaps? Buffalo maybe? Those are NOT NY bagels. Again, as in the pizza. Maybe its the water.

Say no to fast food on a road trip... this place was amazing and right off the 10. The lox was fresh. The olive cream cheese spread on point. It is very fresh so can be drippy but worth the mess. Definitely will be back.
Great bagels, great coffee, great coffee cake.  A perfect breakfast!  Friendly staff and happy customers.

Went to a meeting at my sons school and they had bagels on the table, normally I would pass because I am from back east where the bagels are Real bagels. I noticed that these bagels were very large,looked very fresh 
and  loaded with toppings on the sesame and the cinnamon raisin bagels had plump generous portions of raisins. I grabbed 1/2 of one put it in the toaster and when it was done I let it cool. Finally it was ready for the green onion cream cheese, I was blown away!!!!! I have not had a bagel this good in over 12 years. I asked where did these bagels come from and someone finally told me from the Bagelman which often has long  long lines out front. This confirmed  my theory that these were no ordinary bagels these were super bagels.

If you're in the area, stop by The Bagel Man for a bagel for breakfast ... you won't be disappointed! We finally found the opportune time to go in & I got something a little different - a cheese bagel with scallion cream cheese & my date got the Egg & Lox bagel with the works. The bagels were really big and fluffy; I'm hoping they're hot and fresh the entire day, but as we had gone in pretty early in the day, they definitely were. There was a bit too much cream cheese on the bagel but it was easily spread off.

I'm a huge fan of bagels as it is, so it's plain & simple - we'll be back!

Just with once eating here, I'm a big fan! The bagels taste incredibly fresh and have that perfect crust and chewy inside that Einstein or any other supposed "bagel" place can't match. 

I ordered a crazy combo because im a pregnant, hungry mom! It was lox, bacon, and eggs with scallion cream cheese on a warm, freshly baked Everything Bagel. ....ahhhh,it was outstanding. 

The guys working that fine early Sun morning were upbeat, fun and helpful. ..i think they must enjoy their job, which says a lot about the owners. 

I'll def be back again when I'm on this side of the I10.

Amazing. I had lox on an everything bagel with the works. The bagel was fresh out of the oven and still warm. The amount of lox was very generous. Best bagel I've had in Arizona. Highly recommend. Also, I loved how they cut it in half :)
Delicious bagels!!! This is an excellent stop right off the interstate! Friendly and inviting staff! Highly recommend!

This guy's bagels are the best I've had in the area. This local joint would put any chain and most of their competition to shame. Definitely stop by if you are in Tempe/Ahwatukee area. The bread literally melts in your mouth.
The best bagels in Ahwatukee.  The staff is always friendly and helpful even when they are busy.

This place was amazing. Long line but worth the wait. Ordered their breakfast bagel with sausage and jalapeño spread. It was out of this world good. Felt like I flew to NYC for breakfast. Definitely recommend this place.
It was super yummy!! Reminded us of when we were in Queens, NY. Great food, environment, friendly staff and bagels were as advertised, NY delicious.

This place is yummy! I had the everything bagel with jalepeno  cream cheese. It was delicious and the owner is really cool too. The only reason I gave this place 4 out of 5 stars is because it's my second favorite bagel shop in the valley. Definitely the best on that side of town. My favorite is all the way east kokobelli :)

Bagel Man is so good I was inspired to write an advertising jingle about the place.  Seriously.

The first thing you have to order is the egg and cheese . . . but with bacon, sausage AND roast ham.  Do it.  Check out the pic I posted . . . LOOK at that cross-section

Next, get wild and crazy.  Get the Lox . . . special ordered with bacon.  Yes.  Trust me.  Unkosher that bad boy.  Garlic toasted bagel, house made scallion cream cheese, Lox AND bacon.  The silky smoked salmon with crispy bacon . . . fantastic.

Everything is held together with excellent bagels that frankly put Chompie's to shame.  Seriously.  And the house made cream cheeses . . . smooth and creamy and decadent.  Yes, decadent.  And they certainly do not skimp on the bacon.

If you live and/or work in northern Ahwatukee, you need to hit this place up
These bagels are beyond fabulous!!!  The owner has a friendly smile and comment for everyone.  Hands down the best bagels I have ever had in AZ.  This place truly is a gem!
No need to bring bagels home from NY! These are chewy goodness. Try the toasted everything bagel with veggie cream cheese. Or the pumpernickel rye with a scallion schmear. Salt bagels sell out early!
The food here is amazing! Love how they use good ingredients and make their bread the old traditional way. Plus it's a private small business who I much rather support than some big corp.

Little hidden gem! I have had this spot booked mark for sometime now and finally made it to try out!

Very small bagel spot in a large strip mall.  I would say mostly take out in terms of eating, with a few tables outside. Let me preface this by saying I'm from Long Island where we take bagels very seriously!! So I was stoked when I saw the good reviews about this place.  

I ordered cinnamon raisin bagel with veggie cream cheese ( don't knock it till you try it). I was pleasantly surprised, the cinnamon raisin had lots of flavor and the veggie cream cheese had crisp veggie chunks in it which it great!! 

I ordered 6 bagels to go of other flavors and those didn't  disappoint and they held up in softness and weren't rock hard the next day , always a plus! Overall defiantly worth checking out if you looking for a cute little bagel place.

Wow! The lox bagel sans tomato and the blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese...yeah you heard right. Who the heck eats two bagels for breakfast...? the blueberry was originally supposed to be for breakfast tomorrow but i just couldn't help myself. True New York bagels that are incredibly soft on the inside. Mmm mmm mm!! I'll be here all week and will certainly be going back!!!

I can't add anything different from other reviews. These are THE best bagels in Arizona. They are made on-site and are served straight off the rack. 

Smiling faces and top notch service. They treat everyone like a friend, offering the best service and food that they can.

Lived in the NYC area for 15 years, got used to a certain standard of bagels. The best I'd found in PHX since moving here in 2012 was Scott's Generations on 7th St. They were decent bagels, but not memorable. Just bought my first dozen at Bagel Man. Excellent, excellent. As good as my favorite place back east. They were still warm, as they should be. The scallion cream cheese I bought was also wonderful. So glad to have found this place. I'll be back, even though it's a 20 minute drive for me.
My New Yorker hubby feels like he's back on Long Island! This place is legit!! Lox on Everything bagel is amazing!!

So excited they're open on mondays now too! 7 days!!! Amazing bagels. The everything's are incredible, but the last two saturdays I've been in they've been out of everythings, which is so disappointing. Great bacon, egg and cheese sandwiches, awesome cream cheeses, etc.

Hallelujah. Finally a decent bagel in this culinary wasteland that is Ahwatukee. No longer will I suffer the insult that is Einstein's or make my colleagues suffer along with me. It's Bagel Man for the office from now on.

Still love this place just as much. It's convenient and locally owned, affordable, variety, and consistent! Thanks to Kal and his quality (and quality staff), you always know you're gonna get a great breakfast or lunch!

Awesome bagels. If you have not had a bagel from the east coast this is the place to try. The cream cheese is very good as well. Service is what you would expect from a mom and pop shop...very personable service. Prices are very reasonable
The Bagel are very good.the line out the door told me all I needed to know, as this was my first time. My wife and I stumbled upon this Bagel shop.
Best  bagels I've found in Arizona. I'm from the east coast and these are as good as bagels back there
Staying by the airport and saw the great reviews for this place.    Took uber over and was not disappointed.    Great service and great bagels

Between Odelay and Bagel Man, these are the top locally owned bagel places in the area. Enjoy both of them and usually alternate between them. Each is a notch above the chain places with Bagel Man's offerings bigger than Odelay. While BM offers the standard fare, Odelay serves some innovative items such as parmesan and black pepper. Really hard to choose between the two so I  just go to both.

I had a breakfast sandwich with bagel and egg.  Wife had breakfast sandwich with bagel, egg and cheese.  Hers was much better.  Mine was okay, but the melted cheese really made the sandwich.  We also ordered a bagel to go.  Bagels were very tasty...  crispy on the outside and a little chewy on the inside.  Everything just tasted very fresh.  Would definitely eat here again, even though we live in Tucson.
If you're looking for an authentic, east coast style bagel, go to East Coast Bagels on Southern at McClintock (near the Goodwill). They close early in the afternoon, but they're so much better.

I love the food and the prices it's very fair and the best begel shop in the valley... But ever since the owner hired a bunch of young kids i haven't wanted to go back... The kids have messed up my order 3 out of four times and they all have attitudes when you go in. I want the owner to come back and run it again.
Best bagels I've ever had!  The owner is very genuine and sweet and the staff is so great too!!  This place is my favorite place to go for a quick breakfast.  I love the bagel man!

My wife and I went to The Bagel Man for a quick breakfast after a few days at a nearby resort.  The excellent service, fair prices, and delicious bagel sandwiches were exactly what we needed.

We met The Bagel Man himself.  He strolled through the door with a smile, greeted everyone, put on an apron and headed to the back to make some more everything bagels (we just took the last one).  

This is the kind of bagel shop I love to find.  Great for breakfast or lunch.  Their bagels and cream cheeses are all homemade, and you can taste the difference!

Great little place to get a coffee and bagel in the morning. Owner is super friendly and has great customer service. Will drive across town anytime to get one of his amazing bagels. Love love love this place!
Fantastic, delicious and fresh bagels!  Fast pleasant service!  Very big portions on the lox bagel with 'the works'.  Will definitely return.

Bagel heaven! The most fluffy, moist bagels ever. True NY style, which are boiled before baking. These suckers are huge, fresh and there are a variety of flavor options to choose from with sandwiches, bagels and fresh cream cheese. The shop isn't anything to look at, but they make up for it with the quality of their food and the kindness of their staff. The honey walnut spread is great as are the cheese and everything bagels (not with that spread...unless special flavor combos float your boat. :-) Go at an off hour in the morning to avoid crowds and sell-outs and don't plan on eating there, as seating is sparse and cramped right against the ordering area. Must try this place!

Wow, So nice to get authentic bagels in Phoenix! Service was friendly and food was delish.  It's definitely a to go spot; I sat here eating for 20 mins and saw 30 people come in and out with dozens of bagels in hand and no one else sat down. I can't believe I've been in ahwatukee more than 7 years and just found this place!

Very small shop, but all items were pretty good. As a true NY guy, I can judge bagels and although these have that crunchy, chewy texture, they were only my 2nd favorite choice now. These don't toast up that well, but they stay fresh for days and probably don't need a freezer for at least 4 days. There is still one other valley bagel shop that gets my nod. Check reviews.
The bagel Sandwich - cute name, can't remember it, but Turkey and they say fresh mozzarella (but it wasn't fresh, just sliced). They use Boars Head here which will always make a sandwich decent and the herb mayo was a good touch too.
Macaroni salad - homemade, but not the best version (go for the bag of chips)

Olive Cream Cheese - $3.50 this was unusual and would say to try it if you like olives of course.
worth a visit for housemade cream cheese alone. best and cheapest lox n bagel sandwich I've had.
It was a great fresh bagels that I every taste they have different cream cheeses.  my husband had a sandwich of ham and cheese he love it they make bagel fresh everyday

This was my go to for bagels in the valley even though it was a shlep. However, he seems to have lost his way. Looks more like The Bread Man now. The bagels have gotten too big and have lost their shape and consistency. 

I'll give it another go in about a month and see if things improve.
Wow, just wow. The best bagel I have had since working for Baffos deli in Dallas back in 1990.

I've been here multiple times and never had one bad experience with this place. The owners and staff here are super friendly, pleasant, and welcoming. 

The shop decor isn't anything fancy. Just a typical authentic NYC bagel shop with fresh bagels made daily, a variety of awesome cream cheeses and toppings, pleasant Jewish owners, diverse staffing and random black and white photos of NYC landmarks. Every time I step into this shop, it feels like I just teleported myself to NYC. 

Great food, awesome people, perfect NYC ambient. The best part is the price you pay is so not NYC! Looking forward to trying out more items on the menu.

I guess it is only fitting that I write a review for The Bagel Man as my husband just left to grab our breakfast there.  As others have said, these bagels are superb and the service is stellar.  The prices are very reasonable and the food is fresh.  No fru-fru coffee drinks here (just the basic cup, which is fine with me), the focus is on the bagels, and that is obvious.  

Small little place and it can get busy, but it seems to go fast.  Get in line, order your food, maybe grab some coffee while you wait.  Pay when it is ready and either sit at one of the few tables inside or sit outside to enjoy the nice AZ weather.

Breakfast sandwiches, fresh made flavored cream cheese (I asked for jalapeno cream cheese and he made some for me on the spot, cream cheese + jalapenos), Boar's Head meat for the lunch sandwiches, and some home baked pastries (from someone else's home).  

With all of the good stuff on the menu, my absolute favorite is the lox and cream cheese on an everything bagel with all the fixin's (tomato, onion, capers). YUM!  I could go on, but my breakfast has arrived and it is time to eat!

Enjoy!

I will preface this review by saying that I have spent most of my life living in New York and I am absolutely critical of all bagels that I eat.

Now, let me say that Bagel Man carries by far the best bagel I have ever tasted outside of New York State. The owner has a location back east as well, so it is no surprise that he knows what he's doing. You can try anywhere else you want in the Phoenix metro region, but you will never find a bagel that comes even close to the flavor and taste of these authentic bagels. Every single one of my family and friends that have come to visit me agree. In addition, anytime I introduce these bagels to any of my local friends they are blown away and from then on will not buy a bagel anywhere else. 

Plain and simple, Bagel Man has the absolute best bagels you will have outside of New York and I have even found in many occasions that his bagels are better than some of the places back east.

Bagel Man was open on a Monday, which they just started doing, but also the Monday during Christmas. This is very kind to do for those that don't want to cook for the holidays! It also saves everyone from the usually chain restaurants. We are frequent customer to this business, but being open on Christmas is truly wonderful. Thank you to all the staff at Bagel Man giving up time with your families to be here for others. Much appreciated.

I stumbled upon this lil gem this morning via my homey Yelp, and once again it steered me right!  These bagels are delicious!  The perfect consistency, density, chewiness, and they boil em!  The way they are supposed to be made... Unlike that chain place out here in the desert :) it's a tiny lil shop in a strip mall and kind of hidden but seek it out and stop in!  Great prices and quality food.  Breakfast and lunch sandwiches as well as some pastries and fresh made cream cheese in house!  Only downfalls would be the size of the place and it was really hot in there.  Just get your food to go and the problem is solved :)
This place is amazing. Owner is friendly, food is amazing...nothing to complain about. I love this place. Want it everyday!!!
Friendly staff, that know and love their food. Lox bagel was delicious and they hooked it up with all the fixings!
Great bagels & bialys! Stop by for a cup of perfect coffee, you won't be disappointed!
I am from back east, these are HANDS DOWN the best bagels I have tasted in AZ.

Great bagels in AZ! Jersey style will always have my heart, but this stop is my go to in Ahwatukee! Vegan options available always a plus for me / Hummus, potatoes, PB&J! Service always great - fast and friendly!
The best bagels in phoenix area... Been here couple of times never disappointed. Friendly staff great service .
Super awesome bagel sandwich. I had the bacon, egg, and cheese on a everything bagel, and it was amazing!
This place is authentic as a NY Bagel place can be. They're also willing to let you try things and make sure you're experience is one you'll talk about. Glad local businesses like this one are here!
I don't like bagels but a friend of mine forced me to try the bagel man and I'm he did. Since then I've had a bagel at least 3x of week!

I'm not sure what all the hype is about this place. I was looking forward to a good New York style bagel after reading all the good reviews. However I was a bit disappointed by the bagel itself, it was a little doughy. I got a ham egg and cheese bagel sandwich and they kinda of skimp on the ham and eggs. Their cream cheese was good though and you can tell they make it in house. Overall it was good for the price but I probably wouldn't come back.
The Bagel Man has THE BEST lox bagel in Arizona. You are missing out if you haven't stopped in.

The best! Old style NY type bagels. The owners are great!  On weekends get here early am for bagels; they are gone early! Deli is all Boars Head. I suggest a hot pastrami on pumpernickel with swiss and mustard! Yum yum yum!
I don't need to write a review because everyone knows that the bagel man is the best vegan in AZ. If you don't believe me just give it try
Great Bagels!   Owner is real deal.  13 bagels for $10 great deal.

Heaven in my mouth. Best bagels in AZ, always fresh. I know bagels pretty well being from NJ. They actually have Taylor Ham... Mind blown. Now that I know this place exists I will be editing some reviews I left for other bagel shops because they have alot to live up to now.

Best Bagels in town hands down!! The cream cheese melts in your mouth, the bagels are just phenomenal! We ordered a blueberry, and a jalapeño bagel...they were not overpowering at all. Very fresh ingredients. Try it at least once and you will not regret it!

The only bagels in Arizona that meet my high Brooklyn standards. These bagels are flaky, crusty, everything that a real bagel, not a round piece of bread with a hole inside, should be. He's even stuck to real bagel types, as you won't find any prissy blueberry or cinnamon sugar bagels like you'd find at Einstein Bros. The owner, Kal, is a Jersey native, so he's as qualified as they come for bagel making. He cares a lot about his product and his customers, and knows almost everyone who walks in the door by name. Every time I visit, he remembers that I drive from Phoenix, want a baker's dozen, and need extra freezer bags. Also he has egg bagels. Yay egg bagels!

Last time I went, he even agreed to start making egg everything bagels for me (egg bagels with the everything bagel's topping set). So stop on in and get one!

I've had friends ship bagels to me from New York and they were always better than anything I can get here in Phoenix. The bagels here at Bagel Man are just as good as anything I've had from New York. The service is good and friendly. Prices are great. Sandwiches are awesome. My favorite is the Rich & Famous on a salt bagel. Definitely worth the trip.

I do love coming here. It has a city feel right here in my suburb. I like that it is a small owner run Business. The service is always very friendly. Delicious food. The lox breakfast sandwich is one that I often crave.

The Bagel Man deserves all the rave reviews!  I was up early this morning wondering who was open at 5:30 a.m., and was also looking for a place I've never been and this joint fit the bill.  I had a honey wheat bagel toasted with the honey almond spread and it was delicious!  Warm and chewy and just what my belly needed that early in the morning.  The employees were fast and friendly too.  I've attached photos of their menu as of today.  This would be a perfect stop before a hike or bike ride on South Mountain.  And a great stop for lunch when you're done.  I can't wait to grab the unsuspecting Mr. M and go back.  The only reason I would ever go back to Einstein Bros. was if I was craving a cinn/sugar bagel.
I've had bagels around Az for the past 10 years. This place is definitely the best, the owner has another location in New Jersey. Great service and food! Highly recommended.

Pork roll, egg and cheese on everything?  Yes they got that. And probably the only place in AZ that has pork roll, or even knows what it is. I ordered it and the guy automatically knew I was from Jersey. These are real bagels. Not rolls with holes.  If there are two things that sum up a man from Jersey its bagels and pork roll. Damn close to the bagels I know and love from my hometown. Though I live in Gilbert I will be making the drive to Ahwatukee for my dozens.

I got the egg and lox sandwich on an everything bagel with plain cream cheese. The bagel was so fresh out of the oven that they didn't even need to heat the bagel for my warm sandwich. The bagel was absolutely delicious and there was a good amount of lox and toppings for the price. The prices are a lot more reasonable compared to the other bagel places in the area. My boyfriend got the sausage and egg sandwich on a plain bagel (he's a plain eater) and said it's the best bagel sandwich he's ever had from a place in Arizona. 

The staff was so incredibly friendly. Even though it was my first time there and I was so overwhelmed with the amount of yummy things to choose from, the employees helped me decide what to get and I'm so glad they did. 

There isn't much space to eat so my boyfriend and I got it to go and had a picnic at a near by park. I wish there was more seating because all the tables were full. The food was so good though that I didn't mind at all and I will definitely be back very soon. I'm happy to give all my bagel business to The Bagel Man from now on!

I've never been to this shop, but someone at my work brings these bagels in every Friday.. to Dunlap and Peoria. They are awesome bagels!!!! .. Very fresh, the absolutely best I've ever tasted anywhere.

Just stopped in for the first time. Got a simple bacon, egg and cheese on an everything bagel. Fantastic. I don't know how they make something so simple taste so good. Don't be thrown off by the small, slightly dated interior, this place is amazing!

The bagels are fantastic! I work near here and stop by for lunch from time to time. They use Boar's Head deli meat which is the only way to go in my opinion. They are also very quick to make my food, which I definitely appreciate. The restaurant is small and no frills, but the service and food are terrific!
This I probably one of my favorite egg sandwich shops we stop here a lot to pick up something and they are so quick

Best bagel shop I've ever been to, kills anywhere on Maui and half the price! Fresh huge bagels and a New York flair of soft cream cheese and really fresh ingredients. Owner is a great guy, too. He gave me samples for the road, even.

Nothing, I mean nothing, will ever beat an H & H bagel if you are from the NYC area.
But I have to say I was pleasantly surprised while in Phoenix last week to have a delish NY style bagel shop across the street from my hotel.  The Bagel Man makes a good bagel. And even better tuna salad and I am a tuna lover.  Better than my Jewish mom's tuna salad!  It even came with a pickle and some pretty decent potato salad.
They even have some deli sandwiches. All at reasonable prices.
How good is this place?  They close at 2pm and by 1:30 when we got there they only had 3 bagels left. Not 3 flavors, 3 bagels.  Got my pumpernickel, hubby got the last poppy. Now I have to fly back to Phoenix for the tuna on an everything bagel and get there before closing.

I cannot stress this enough. If you arrive here while the Bagels are coming fresh out of the oven DO NOT order them toasted. The fresh bagel is perfection. It will be crackly on the outside and chewy and tender on the inside. Toasting is for store bought bagels.

The service here is a little haphazard, many of the workers will try and take your order, just talk to one of them and your order will be fulfilled. I had an Everything Bagel with Sliced Lox Sandwich. 3 days in a row. And while the salty Lox maybe the big draw for some, the bagel was the star of the show. Long meetings and lactose intolerance prevented me from enjoying the simple delights of a Bagel and Cream Cheese (of which they have many flavors). But I can tell you these Bagels are good enough to eat dry.

Do not miss out on this place. If you are staying at the Sheraton, brave that 120° parking lot. It is worth even that.

Came to the Bagel Man looking for a new breakfast spot and was anything but disappointed.   The freshness of the bagels along with the varieties was both impressive and delicious.  I ordered an egg, cheese, bacon bagel sandwich for $4 and i love the option of adding tomatoes/onions at no cost.  An ice coffee is $1.99.  Overall, you'll be left satisfied with an excellent meal for $6.  I will be a frequent customer from now on.
This place is spectacular. I had an everything bagel with egg, bacon and American cheese. Not too filling, reasonably priced. I'll definitely be back here soon.

My BF and I have been testing bagels throughout the Valley, trying to find our NY-style favorite. Coming from the East Coast we've been struggled to find good bagels and seafood. Well, The Bagel Man has both. The Lox was great and so was the wide variety of bagels. 

Beyond the good food, this place also has a great atmosphere. Immediately upon entering the store, we were greeted by the owner and one of his staff members. We also got a few extra things thrown in our order, probably because we came in on a Sunday just before closing time. 

Can't wait to be back.
Yummy bagels and cream. My favorite is jalapeno bagel and veggie cream cheese toasted. Me and my boyfriend love going there.

Hello. Need to educate. From Brooklyn Staten Island Catskills New York  and Nj. Loved the bagel mans style of bagel. Had the jalapeño plain with nothing on it and the everything plain nothing on it. Would come back and purchase bagels again. I have eaten from the best ny bagel bakeries in the ny area for 55 years. AUTHENTIC BAGELS ARE BOILED AND THEN BAKED. Like any baker it is an art. Fact, these bagels are excellent in their own right. They are not New York style bagels in the least bit. Anyone claiming they are is out of touch with reality. If you are from New York and are looking for authentic style jewish ny bagels then a trip to chompies bakery in Scottsdale is where they have the old style rye breads pumpernickel breads bagels and cakes that you grew up with back in the 1950's. Chompies also has a Sattelite store on w frye rd by the chandler mall. This being said I enjoy both styles very much. The classic ny chompies style bagel and the bagel mans recipe for his bagels which are excellent also. As for NEW JERSEY, there is no such thing as a nj style bagel. You can buy a bagel at 50 different stores in nj and get 50 different tastes and textures. There is only one way to make a classic by style Jewish bagel which is where they originated but there are thousands of variations. The bagel man makes one of the best variation of a NY STYLE BAGEL, but the taste and texture have nothing to do with the ny original. Call it an Arizona style bagel and it hands down wins the title best Arizona style bagel

Cool place. It is rare to see the owner/operator still spending time at the counter, talking, greeting and even hugging some close customers. But their bagel is the best. I had a breakfast sandwich with lox and scrambled egg, onion, caper...that was delicious. Fresh and toasted everything bagel was absolutely the right base for all that on top. He even announced to incoming customers what kind of bagel just came off the baking oven...I have my eyes on either the Boss or the New York Ruben for the next return.

This place is fantastic, mom and pop shop feel, super friendly with customers and always efficient and tasty with their food. 

Come here about 1 to 2 times a week and grab large orders for me and my co-workers never a complaint from anybody. 

All varieties of bagels and bagel sandwiches are available and everything is always fresh, this place is a must.

Firstly, you know you're doing things right if your friends live across the street from the Bagel Man and they take you every time you come to town! Second you know you're going to have a good day once you are eating the delicious bagels and food there! And lastly you know the world is right when a kind gentleman comes up and buys you your entire lunch!

All fun aside, the Bagel Man has some of the best bagels I've ever had in my life. And coming from a Jew I think that means a lot! I always have the egg bagels if they have them in stock but I dare you to try anything there and tell me it's not good. The quality of the food is perfect. The staff and owner are incredibly lovely, friendly and personable. Makes me wish I lived just across the street! 

Thanks Bagel Man! (And the guy who bought me my lunch!)

I often travel and there it is such a treat when I find a hidden gem.  The Bagel Man has forever changed my expectations of the Bagel.  Best I've ever had.   And the service proves they love what they do.

The best bagel we've had in the Phoenix area. Bagels are large yet airy and flavorful. Being an ice tea lover, I'm thrilled that they have a fresh fruity tea. They have stevia too which is a plus. We haven't had their sandwiches but have heard they're delish.

Unbelievable!!! Cal (owner) is an amazingly gracious and friendly guy!! He will know and remember you after your first visit. These are far and away the BEST bagels I've ever eaten, ever! Made completely from scratch ON SITE!!  You can see them being mixed, proofed, boiled and baked!!  Taste them fresh and hot straight from the kitchen!! This place, the staff, the food feel like home!! THE BEST!!!!

A friendly atmosphere with an amazing owner. He always lets me wait for the freshest bagel and is from the northeast and my hometown so he definitely understands what makes a good bagel. Don't waste your time at einsteins bagel. I've recommended his restaurant to many people, no one has been disappointed!

4.5* rounded up because the round dough with holes in the center trying to pass for bagels in PHX & Las Vegas are so severely lacking in any semblance to what they are supposed to be, that when I find a place like this, after kissing the ground like the Pope, I round up. The Man knows how to make bagels, people. And bialys! Bialys, I tell you: I wanted to cry when I saw them. 

Anywho, my SILs have lived in the 'Tuk forever,  when we moved here they told us see the Man about some NY style bagels. The first time we went it was at opening, and our bagels were still hot! The salt and pumpernickel are my favorites; Scott is an everything or egg man: "Goo goo g' joob" (that's the Beatles, millennials) When my Mom was here, she asked for bagels every day: Brooklyn born and bred stamp of approval!

They do run out of bagels early, you will encounter a line occasionally, but they move quick. 5* as good as it gets in PHX fo sho! 

* closed Mondays *
** they have deli sammies **
** breakfast menu ***
**** nice lox and yummy homemade cream cheese varieties ****
Hands down, best bagel in Arizona. This bagel shop dishes up original NY style bagels. Inexpensive, unassuming and always great service. keep it up guys!

I wasn't sure what to expect when walking in, I didn't check reviews first because I always give bagel places a chance. I'm from Ohio and miss the great Jewish NY-style deli's I had all around me, because there is a serious lack of them in Arizona. However, Bagel Man has the best bagels in the valley. They have great varieties and are incredibly delicious and last for longer than most you would get at Chompie's or some other fake deli. The owner was awesome, he introduced himself and was doing everything well. They serve Boar's Head meat which is the best if you ask me and they have some variety for being a small place. I recommend this place to all for a nice little lunch or bringing bagels home or to the office.

A great bagel is hard to find west of the Northeast. The Bagel Man produces bagels the follow the traditional method of boiling the dough before finishing it off in the oven. It's what provides the shiny and crispy exterior that covers the soft and chewy moist dough on the inside. A bagel that is simply baked is nothing more than baked bread..........and should never be referred to as a bagel. This was a great Yelp find and I'm sure to return whenever we are in the area.

Bagel with Lox I had here was the BIGGEST one I have ever had in my life in Midwest life, East Coast life, and West Coast life all combined. It was HUGE with the most generous amount of lox and other stuff in it - like a lox explosion! I couldn't believe it.

And it was tasty.

Delish!!  The best bagel I've ever had.  We tried, cheese, plain, jalepeno and everything.   All have great flavor and texture.  The egg sandwiches are great too.  Friendly service and reasonable price for a big bagel.  We'll be back!

Oh man am I coming here for breakfast again! I workout right across the 10 on Elliot, and today I was feeling completely famished afterwards. Yelped some nearby breakfast locations and this seemed to have great reviews. I'm not from New York, but I do have decent bagel standards. My so, who IS from New York, was with me, and he has high bagel standards. 

The place still had customers hanging around even though it was only an hour until they supposedly close at noon. We were greeted by two people, one of which  guessing was the owner (by other review descriptions). Our orders were taken immediately and rung up. The owner was cheerful and jokingly said that 'I would never go to Starbucks again after I tasted their coffee'. I'm not hard to please and ordered a breakfast sandwich with bacon on a sesame bagel, and a small coffee. My so ordered the same thing on a cinnamon raisin bagel. 

Bagels were tasty! And the eggs looked real. Not that liquid egg stuff. The coffee was yummy and I was happy! My so said that this looked like a typical bagel joint back in NY, with baskets of bagels, a small crew and quick service. I would definitely come here again after workouts for a quick breakfast stop. Bagels are way better here than from any major chain. It looks like they also have lunch sandwiches and a few other things to try.

Six months ago I moved back to Phoenix from living in NYC for a few years, and these bagels bring me back.  They are consistently baked perfectly and have that wonderful balance of chew and crisp and air and softness. Only thing I miss is the non-dairy based cream cheese options... Would love it if they offered at least one non-dairy variety.  So I usually just buy mine to go and smear at home.

Super nice, helpful owner who has been making bagels in New Jersey and AZ for 30+ years.  It shows!  Bagels are large and fluffy with a decent crust. Toppings on both sides and great homemade cream cheeses. Veggie is my favorite!
Can't go wrong here and we've already been back a few times in just a few weeks!

Everyday I wake up dreaming about these bagels! This is the place to be!

The bagel man is such a hard working guy and is always welcoming to every customer that comes in. He is there pretty much everyday and has a hard working crew too.

The bagels here are seriously the best bagels I have ever had. I have even visited New York and these are on par if not better. Top cream cheese spread would have to be the scallion but the Lox comes in a close second for me. As for bagels, the salt bagel is the best I have ever had. 

The prices are great and it's a great pick me up early in the morning. I'm already looking forward to tomorrow morning just so I can have a bagel.

Fantastic bagels! They toast them just enough so the bagels are hot, but still chewy and soft when you get them. The bagels are fresh and fluffy, try one of the lunch bagel sandwiches. The place is small with a line but it moves quickly.

Oh the humanity of it all, that your located in Awatukee. Let me start by saying that this bagel shop is clean; that being said there is no atmosphere but who is expecting atmosphere in a bagel shop. The bagels are some of the best I've had in Phoenix and definitely worth the drive. I found the owner (I'm guessing he was the bagel man) to be polite, client orientated, and knowledgeable. If I didn't know any better I would say that the bagel man is from a small town somewhere, because memories of my childhood in the Midwest were reminiscent as we experienced all that was the bagels from the bagel man.  Mr. Bagel man all you need to do now is deliver bagels to my office in downtown phoenix and the world would be tolerable.

Love this spot! It gets quite busy so time is needed to stand in line but the bagels are worth it. There aren't any fancy gourmet options like Einstein's but that's what I like abt this place. The bagels are traditional, fresh and fluffy good! Desserts are from the east coast and that coffee cake!  
The staff is quite friendly and prices are def reasonable ;)

I think the thing for those who don't know good bagels is that they see bagels as bread that you spread butter or cream cheese on and it may have some sort of toppings . For someone who really knows the real thing, it is so different than that. Maybe it's nostalgia for the delectable deliciousness of a semi hard exterior with a fluffy interior.
