Or the subtle semi salty after taste. The smear should also be of high quality. It's not Philadelphia cream cheese. A good bagel place will make their own.

The Bagel man is definitely that. This is by far the best bagel place west of the Mississippi. It honestly competes and is on par with what New York has to offer. The owner is a kind man who knows what he is doing and remembers his customers even after long absences.
The lightest tastiest bagel! We had an everything bagel with sliced lox and cream cheese and an cheese bagel with egg and sausage; both delicious.

If you're coming to The Bagel Man, I would recommend you leaving your house/work ten minutes early because of the line. There is plenty of parking within the area and tables outside for seating. Once you're done ordering, you get your food out within a jiffy HOT and good. YUM! In my opinion, lines that goes beyond the entry of any restaurant is a good sign based on the quality of the food and the loyalty of returning customers. The Bagel Man fits the quality of the food and returning customers.

A drive from chandler to the "bagel man" well worth the time. 

I actually met Cal this morning, and he showed me his bagel making operation. Can't get any fresher than this.
They were out of lox so I quickly decided on a bacon, egg, and cheese on onion. I was not disappointed! That sandwich was made with love

Yes, they are open. 
 Major holidays, minor holidays and even Monday. 

Aside from being open they have great hand rolled bagels that are hot and fresh.  Most of the varieties are the usual suspects, but their cheese bagel has a wonderful surprise in the center as the cheese melts into the hole, and caramelizes on the bottom, it is the real treasure. They also have in house made specialty cream cheeses and a variety of sandwiches. On weekends the line can be long and slowish but it is worth the wait.

Somebody on this site recommended the toasted everything bagel with lox, tomato, and chive cream cheese, so I got that, and yup, you were right -- IT WAS GOOD!!!  To your recommendation, I say also get the capers and onions on that.  Mmm mmm. Four and a half stars.

This place was awesome. Great food and great service. The owner Kal was there and hands-on working and making sure everyone is getting great service. After we order, he have us 3 extra bagel free..thank you! Fresh brew coffee was also so good.. definitely coming back.

Do you know "The Bagel Man"? That serves off Elliot Road?!
Best bagel hands down in PhX

I would give this place a 5 but every time I come in for breakfast 2 hours before they close... They always sell out before they close. This place makes there bagels fresh every day, but doesn't seem to make enough for the demand.. The owner is really sweet, and the staff is great.. But there sacking on making enough bagels... When I get my hands on 1 they are amazing! Should be voted best bagels in Arizona, hands down..

Arizona bagels almost always leave my heart yearning for New York City, but this bagel shop took us there and beyond! The bagels are fresh and delicious- a warm fluffy inside and a perfect toasty outside. The generous amounts of smear was homemade and flavorful. Most importantly was the man selling us bagels. He was SO sweet and friendly and put extra love into our order. It was like he took his shop in NYC and transplanted it off of Elliot. He was the bagel man! 

This will be a regular stop on our trips to Phoenix for sure. Can't say enough good things!
Best bagel I've had outside of Brooklyn. The owner is very nice and welcoming. The cream cheese is also fantastic and they make a great bagel breakfast sandwich.
Really good bagels! First time here and staff was really nice. Ended up leaving with a dozen of bagels!

Another Yelp breakfast search success! Bagel Man whips up one delicious breakfast sandwich that hollers New York authenticity. The eggs, meat, and cheese bust out from the fresh and spongy bagels. There's a reason they're called Bagel Man and not Bagel Boy - this is a grown up establishment.

I came through on a Saturday morning. Craving eggs and coffee, I had searched Yelp while driving through the area. The outstanding reviews convinced me so I pulled on over. The restaurant can be a little cramped with the counter taking up most of the space. My eyes darted around the large menu behind it, covered in tasty bagel options. They've got quite the spread, and I don't mean what goes on your bagel! The smear options go for days. 

I ordered the scrambled eggs with sausage and cheese on a wheat bagel. It came out wrapped up in foil to go. The bagels are soo good. They consistency isn't bready, it's more pliable and buttery. The trick is in the boiling and baking. Very scientific. 

The store is a little warm, but the real heat is coming from their kitchen. Check out this gem of a bagel shop off the I-10/Elliot.
Excellent fresh bagels!!  These bagels are just as good as bagels from NYC!  Great service too.  Whenever I am in the area, I will stop by for breakfast.  Loved the bacon, egg and cheese.

BEST BAGELS I have had in Phoenix.  Ok, I don't know much about bagels but my roommate does.  This place not only has excellent bagels they have exceptional service.  He said the only way to tell if a bagel is good is to get the bagel of your choice with plain cream cheese.  He picked everything and since I don't much care for bread I ordered nothing.  While he waited for his bagel he asked for water the owner told him take any cup and help yourself to ice Tewa if you like.  Excellent business practice!  The bagel arrived and looked perfect, nicely toasted with a healthy helping of smear.  I took my fourth of his bagel and enjoyed every bite.  As we sat in the parking lot we decided what the heck it's practically lunch, and headed right back in for a bagel sandwich.  As we were trying to decide what to order the clerk said there was no reason to split the sandwich his half meat my half veggie because he would give me a free sandwich!  So I had the everything bagel all veggies and fresh mozzarella cheese....delish!!  He has a grilled chicken with roasted peppers, bacon and herb aoli.  Also a total win!  Now, I don't like to eat bread because it leaves me feeling sluggish but not these bagels.  I felt great and full of energy all day.  Now do I expect a free bagel every time? Nope.  But the Bagel Man has 2 new customers.  4 stars for yummy chewy, crispy outside, flavorful bagels and the extra star for over-the-top exceptional customer service.  Making plans to go back tomorrow......yum!

Due to the many positive ratings here we did expect the best ! And we were not disappointed.
Delicious bagels ! Friendly service. Keep it up !
Driving from UofA in Tucson to California at 7am. So glad we yelped bagel places and found this place! Friendly staff, delicious bagels and a perfect amount of cream cheese. Yum! Thanks Bagel Man!

He makes the bagles fresh daily in the true New York style. I never thought I would find this when I returned to Phx from NYC. The owner was friendly and committed to the quality of his product. I shall return, again and again...

I was looking for a breakfast sandwich like back home and this place has them!!! I loves my huge bacon,egg, and cheese on an everything bagel. Get past the decor to get a bagel,shear, or sandwich quickly!! I'll be back to try a reuben!!

A little light on bagels at noon.  Stopped in randomly without looking at yelp so based on the mom and pop shop appearance I didn't know what I was going to get.  Mom and pop shops are either mediocre or awesome.  I'm happy to say bagel man is AWESOME!  I took my first bite and immediately picked up my phone to write a review.  

Then I found out yelp loves this place too.  Damn I was late to the party!  :)

Unfortunately I felt the need to dock a star as they only had 3 bagel choices at lunch time.  Maybe someone cleared them out.  I'll try again soon :)

I love this place, but this is twice now that the bagels came with a little amount of cream cheese on them which beats the purpose of getting a "bagel w/ cream cheese". Also, not a fan of the egg bagel at all. 

Nonetheless, I will be back here time and time again because of how delicious the bagels normally are and service being great.

I have always had great bagels from Bagel Man, but today was something else. Today Bagel Man ran out of bagels (which rarely happens there, but hey, they only have the ability to make so much before an oven just can't keep up). I happened to get one of the last everything bagels and had it with tomato, onion, capers, cream cheese and lox. It was the most amazing bagel I have ever had, EVER! Cal is always so nice and recognizes his regulars. This place is such a gem. If you're in the area and it's not Monday (the one day they close) you must go!

Absolutely perfect! Bagels are fluffy and delicious and right on target.  And the kicker... They have pork roll!  They make the best breakfast sandwiches and the prices will not drain your bank account.
Best beagles ever fresh made daily & great costumer service. Super  delicious , we are definitely coming back for more !!!!

Checked this place out after hearing about their awesome bagels.. The cashier was probably one of the rudest people ever and gave an older lady and gentleman such attitude, as well as his fellow co-workers.. However the bagel with scambled egg and lox was delicious! And the kid who made it felt really bad for the customer service and apologized.

This place is dangerous since it's right next to EOS gym.  Some days the amazing smells win out and I have to go in for a cinnamon raisin or cheese bagel. There is always several people in line and for good reasons, the Bagels are super fresh and really good.  If you really like cream cheese you'll be in heaven because you get a lot and I mean a lot. The selection of bagels is good and they offer tons of sandwich options too.

My being a native New Yorker means I'm qualified to make this statement. This is the best bagel spot that I've found in the valley. I may or may not be proud of it, but with every visit here I'm eating at least two bagels. Keep it up Bagel Man. You put the TEN in Gluten.

Water boiled bagels are the only way to go and these bagels hit the mark. I would definitely go more often if there was more of a selection at a bit more competitive price. 

We're from Santa Cruz and Scott actually used to be the baker at the Bagelry so I've had some pretty epic bagels.  In addition at the Begalry they had so many different kinds of schmeers, my favorites being hummus and egg salad on garlic.  It would also be cool if there was a nice rich sun-dried tomato schmeer.
Gonna make this one short and sweet. . Really like this place . The bagels are awesome and always fresh .cant go wrong going to this place. The owner is really cool and always greet me respectfully .

Outstanding true NY style bagels and friendly staff. Found this place on Yelp and read nothing but great reviews and took entire family here for breakfast while on vacation. The bagels are so soft yet have a perfect little crisp/crunch to them. I got a bacon, egg, cheese bagel and it was to die for. Give The Bagel Man a try....you won't be disappointed.

First let me tell you my theory about NY bagels.  I left NYC in 1958 so my recall is of that era.  The last true bagel bakers were unable to interest their grandchildren to become bakers and the "art" slowly morphed from the '40s - '50s style to the 21st century, baked by non-Jewish bakers of other origins.
Yes they still boiled and then baked but were different.  Not not good or great but a new style for a new people.  We love things based on good memories and the current younger population likes their newer style of bagel, hence the great reviews that I can't agree with as I am (a long retired New Yorker longing for the bagels of yore:)  To me a bagel always has a distinct hole in it's center, a shiny, tough, and lightly crunchy rich brown crust and a chewy dense interior.  I thought that Bruegger's Bagels came close.  They are gone from our area but still in Tucson.
Bagelman's bagels taste good, they are however not what I expected and hence not a NY bagel to ME!
Their Bialy however is too dense, as their bagel is not dense enough.  
To all the young folk out there (born less than 50 years ago), you will love Bagelman's baking!!! Mr. Bagelman, keep it up, you are indeed pleasing those you need to please!

Highly recommend the Bagel Man! Prices are just right, the bagels are delicious. Owner is always friendly. Sometimes there's a line, it moves quick and the bagels are worth it. I've never been to NY but I hear from other customers that these bagels are spot on. Get there earlier in the morning though on the weekends--if you go later than 9 or 10 am they may be out of the bagel you want. (I always make sure to have a "backup" bagel plan.)

Bagel man makes the best bagels in the Valley.  Hands down.  Crispy, chewy circular delights that make you question the existence of places like Einsteins.  His lox and egg breakfast sandwich is about the best meal 6$ can buy in the region.  If you know better, hit me up because I want to go to there.

5-stars for Bagels...but if you are looking for specialty coffee blends, other assorted baked goods, or a coffee shop hangout stop with free wifi, LOOK ELSEWHERE. My rating compares these bagels to those that I have tried out of a bag at a grocery store, to chains that claim bagels should be smart, and to the only other family owned shop in the east valley that claims they know bagels for 'back east'. Bagel man bagels are exeptionally larger and pretty much consistent in their round,donut-shape, something that constantly bothers me about the competitor. Because these have a consistant round puffy shape, they might not be as dense and crusty on the outside when stored and reheated in the toaster, which is what I like to do.
Bottom line, i like the huge, round puffy shape. I also love their walnut rasin cream cheese but for me this is definitely an eat the same day bagel, which is fine with me.
This is a very basic, tiny, family owned shop that specializes in very good bagels and a few freshly made cream cheese selections. It has a counter with basic coffee and a fountain drink machine, that's all!!! Come here and rate it for the bagels only.
Sweet sassy molassey! These are some gooooood bagels. In fact, I think these are the best bagels I've ever had. You have to try some. They will change the way you look at breakfast breads forever!
Hands down the best bagel I have ever had! The owner is enthusiastic and energetic!   I highly recommend it.

This now is my main bagel stop. Forget that high price frozen dough and microwaved egg places. The bagel man hand makes freshly dough bagels with stovetop fresh eggs. I get the bacon or ham, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel-YUM! Only problem is space; it's crowded and small.

Great food here, but my only complaint is that they don't write things down. I'm sure this would enhance the over customer experience because it seems like there is always confusion between the back and front. A simple marker would solve everything at this place. It would move the line faster and make it easier for literally everyone. Coming from Long Island I am a very harsh critic of egg sandwiches and bagels and can tell you that the food is great here. 

This place would be the best in the state if it wrote down orders for everyone.

We get bagels here every week and they never disappoint! They're always fresh, large, and so delicious you barely want to put cream cheese on them (you should though-theirs is perfect!) The coffee cake is to die for and the people who run the shop are all so friendly and kind. If you're looking for a great breakfast experience or really miss authentic bagels, definitely give this place a try!

The Bagel man.... Our group was visiting AZ and I decided that I would use Yelp to find an awesome breakfast place. Well, the Bagel man came up and ... because we don't have many great bagel places in Hawaii, we jumped at the chance!
After riding our luxurious bus to the strip mall, we see "The Bagel Man" right in front of us!
It's PACKED!!!!!!!!!  A GOOD SIGN!
We go in and stand in line chatting excitedly and this guy bumps into me and says "sorry" - it's the THE Bagelman!!!!! I told everyone "hey the Bagel man bumped into me"!!!!!!
OK, not many bagels left - because it's close to 12 and they close at 12. Still, several options to choose from.
How did it taste? Well, it was great! Different from some other bagels I usually eat on the mainland - a little lighter with a good bite. Perhaps not as chewy, but still great! Someone else ordered a walnut bagel and it was incredible. I had the breakfast bagel and it was very good - excellent. The coffee was standard diner fare but got the job done.

The workers are FUNNY! I can't repeat what they said, but hang around and you hear funny stuff over and over!

Next time I go back, the Bagel Man will be on my list again!!!!!!

Best bagels I've had in Phoenix!   I'm from the East Coast and LOVE bagels, but I was pretty disappointed with other places in the area until I tried The Bagel Man.  These are truly authentic tasting, felt like straight out of a deli from NY or NJ.  

I had the everything bagel with cream cheese, lox, tomato, and onion.  The bagel was absolutely delish - crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside without being super thick.  This was exponentially better than Chompies and extremely well-priced.

The service was great!  I was in and out on a busy Sunday morning within a few minutes.  Also, I think it may have been the owner who waited on me, but he was so friendly and nice.  There were 2 other guys who took orders and they were also very friendly.  Great customer service.

Will definitely be back.  If you live anywhere near Ahwatukee definitely support a local business like this one.
These are the best bagels around by far!  If you like bagles like I do, you have got to try The Bagel Man.  Everything is great!

I love this place.  So many selections without the crowd at other outstanding bagel places. This place in Ahwatukee can be hard to find just by driving tucked away with other great restaurants.  Would highly recommended to anyone who LOVES everything bagels.

I'm from NJ and lived in Manhattan for a while. One of the things I really wanted to find was a great bagel place that scratched that East coast itch. This place definitely has the nice outer crust gloss with a great soft chew in the middle like the bagels in NJ and NY. Get there earlier because some of the flavors run out on the weekend. We got a bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything along with cream cheese and a dozen. The egg was fried, not scrambled and everything tasted as it should! Love this place!
This is the best bagel place I've ever been to. The owner is super nice and the bagels and cheese are both fresh. Nothing else compares to this.

OMG!  where to start... This place has amazing from scratch homemade bagels and cream cheeses and is a local mom-and-pop business.  You must try their breakfast bagel sandwiches, they are to live for!  My favorite is the toasted cinnamon raisin bagel with egg bacon cheddar cheese and honey maple raisin nut cream cheese on the side.

I was transported to a morning on the island. Long Island, that is! I had the lox sandwich on an onion bialy which includes cream cheese, tomato, red onion, and capers. It was perfect! Service was super friendly and the workers were so welcoming! Love it!

I hopped on my Yelp app looking for a place nearby my work where I could grab a quick sandwich and I found the Sub Factory.  As I pulled into the parking spot, I noticed the Bagel Man right next door with a Boars Head sign in the window.  No contest.  I love Boars Head so I decided to go there instead.  From the outside, it doesn't look like much, it doesn't look like much from the inside either - small and no attention to the décor at all.  An incredibly friendly gentleman greeted me and he could immediately tell it was my first time there.  I told him I wanted a turkey sandwich with mozzarella and while trying to decide on what type of bread I wanted, he suggested I eat it on a bagel, he said that I can't find bagels like that anywhere else and promised me that this wouldn't be my last visit to his bagel shop.  I found him irresistible, it may have been the accent combined with the fact that I had just returned home from NYC where these little bagel shops owned by foreigners are in abundance.  Since it was late in the day, already past 2:00 by the time I was able to break away from work, the bagel options were slim so I settled on a salt bagel which I had never had before.  When I got back to my office and started eating my sandwich I realized that he was right, the bagel was delicious and he made a patron out of me.  I've been back four times and I get the same amazing service each time and I haven't veered from the salt bagel yet, it's so delicious.  When my dad wanted to meet me for breakfast we met here and he thought it was a great little bagel shop, too.  Next time there is a morning meeting at work, we're ordering from this place, forget Einstein's!

I love this man.  The bagel man.  He is incredibly friendly, efficient and makes a HELLUVA bagel.  I've tried almost everything here, since it's in my hood, and the only complaint I have is that they're too busy in the mornings to take phone orders!  

The first time I stopped in, I paid for my meal and he looked at me and said "you'll be back"... he was right, but I didn't think it would be the next morning!  

It's nice when small businesses like this GET IT - and are able to consistently crank out a quality product within their niche.  Clearly his recipes are spot on, for the bagels and the schmear which are made fresh daily.

If you like bagels, or breakfast, or really personable small business owners, come here - you won't regret it!!

The best bagels and chive smear! The owner makes you feel like family and all other associates are always so friendly and helpful. I always recommend this place and literally the best everything begal you will ever find!

I'm no bagel expert or connoisseur by any means; all I know is that the lox and cream cheese bagel is delicious every time I have it here. Price is fair, line is quick, and I always leave satisfied. There's nothing overly fancy or amazing that warrants five stars but I can't find any reason not to give it five stars either at this point.
So delicious fresh bagels makes food right on the spot
I don't know what changed here but the service issues have been 'highly improved'. Keep it up bagel man!

"The  Bagel Man" opened his shop a little over a year ago and I have always wanted to stop in and see what it is all about.  I do a lot of traveling and I always look forward to enjoying a fresh bagel whenever I get to the east coast.  Authentic New York Bagels are very hard to find on the west coast.  This morning I was out and about and decided to stop in and pick up some bagels to share.

The Bagel Man greeted me as soon as I walked in the door and cheerfully asked if I had been in before.  I smiled and said no.  As I was giving him my order.  I asked him if he made the bagels on the premises; he cheerfully said yes and I told him I was excited to give them a try.  He said that I would be back!  He told me how he prepared them and I told him that I realy enjoyed the bagles in New York; he said I would be happy I found the shop!

He was right!  The bagels are perfectly crispy on the outside and tender on the inside with wonderful flavor.  When I bite into one I can see the Statue of Liberty through the misty haze...

...anyway The Bagel Man is highly recommened and you won't be disappionted!

Best bagels I've ever had. Before this place I thought I knew what bagels were about, but I was so wrong. I can't reccomend this place enough. Be sure to get their early though, they have quite a fan base

Love this place! My husband and I came here for the first time this morning. It was soooo good! The bagels were fresh and the cream cheese was very tasty! I got the sausage, egg, and cheese (with a side of jalapeno cream cheese) it was very good. I just wished they had a complete list of all the types of cream cheese they have, maybe they do and I missed it. The place is very small. We were going to eat there but there was no place to sit and it was very hot in there. But, I am not complaining. I am just saying it was a small place. They people there are very nice and friendly. We will be going back for sure...soon. :)

I'm originally from jersey and the one thing I miss is a good jersey bagel no where has ever held up to the standards of what I grew up on thus far here in arizona. I stopped in today after hearing about this place and doing some research. The owner is the sweetest, nicest man ever as I told him how excited I was to try a bagel. To say the least he hit it out of the park. His bagels are exactly what a jersey bagel should be and I will definitely be going back and recommending it to anyone that asks for a good bagel. Keep up the great work and I'll be seeing you again soon!

As a New Jersey bagel snob, this 5star review does not come lightly.  Not only are the bagels seriously delicious, warm with just the right balance of fluffy and doughy, the staff are like family. Every time I come in (hungover or poppin fresh) I'm always greeted with a smile and the guys behind the counter do everything to make my order perfect. AND THEY HAVE PORK ROLL! Anyone from New Jersey knows that this is a serious win. TEN STARS. ALL the stars!!!

If you're like me, a New Yorker, we all crave a taste of NYC..... you will simply not taste a better bagel in all of Phoenix. AND I assure you, I have tried everyone's bagels in this town.

For all of you that think it is only the water of NYC that makes a good bagel..... you're wrong. This bagel man makes a bagel to die for.  Just get there in the moring when the bagels are fresh. if you get there between 7 am and 9 am, you will be in for a real NYC treat. AND his veggie cream cheese is also magic.

Sooo good! This is my first visit here. I went close to closing time so they were almost out of everything. I ordered the chicken melt and it was delicious! Order macaroni salad with it. I would defiantly come back I would just get there earlier!

Probably one of the best experiences I have had in recent memory.  Not only were the bagels superb (I got the bacon, egg, & cheese on everything) but the service and friendliness of "Mr. Bagel" were top-notch.  If you like NY-style soft bagels, do yourself a favor and go here.  Wish this was in DC!!  I will DEFINITELY be back!!

Finally checked this place out and glad we did! Yummie fresh bagels and homemade cream cheese! We both got breakfast sandwiches one with sausage and one with bacon, everything was quick and super tasty. The owner and the staff were all very friendly and worked quickly to get our order in. The line was sort of long, but the wait went by extremely quick. If you want a fresh yummie bagel I would highly recommend checking this place out plus I feel it's hard to find places these days with great customer service.
Awesome place.  Just like the shops in NY and NJ.  Same quality Bagels.  They are boiled here, not just baked bread like the other places.  If you have not tried it you must.

I can't believe I've never rated this place. I've been coming here for years. These are the BEST bagels in Phoenix. The outsides are tough but the insides are soft and chewy. The service is amazing. They remember regulars and what they order. You can get a breakfast sandwich and a coffee for $6.  Can't beat that.

I decided to check this place out because the reviews on Yelp were really good, and The Bagel Man did not disappoint. I'm not kidding when I say these are the best bagels I've ever had. It sounds silly, but they're seriously so good! You can tell they are made fresh. The service is so nice and genuine. This is the best hole-in-the-wall breakfast place.

All I can say is that my experience with bagels up to this point has been just absolutely sad. Now that I know how delicious a freshly made bagel can be I am forever changed. My husband and I recently moved from California to Texas and we have had to make two road trips in the span of 2 months to get all of our crap moved. We made a point to stop at this place both times instead of taking the Phoenix Bypass that would save us time on our trip. The food is THAT good here. I love their cheese bagel with the scallion cream cheese spread. My husband has gotten two different bagel sandwiches. Both were delicious. The service is really great here too. The owner is a really friendly dude that seems to genuinely care about his customers. I am really sad that we don't live closer to this place, but you best believe we will stop by on any future road trips. It's probably also a good thing that I don't live too close to this place because I would probably eat their bagels uncontrollably every day if I did!

I've stopped cooking breakfast on the weekends because of this place. The saugage, egg, and cheese; the new york reuben; the scallion schmear; the lox, everything's been fantastic so far. There's been a sizable line every time I've been in, but they keep things moving. Friendly service; fantastic food. If you're in the area, treat yourself.

This is my go to place when I have time to breakfast in the mornings.  I think the word "authentic" is thrown around way too often in Yelp reviews and I am guilty of using too often too . . . so please forgive me for using one more time; The Bagel Man has authentic NYC bagels and frankly, if they weren't they are still amazing.

Meal:  Just pick anything off of the menu.  Don't think . . .just choose.  It will be well worth it.  I recommend that you don't taste the bagel because it ruins the taste, but that is just my preference. 

Taste:  These bagels are the cat's pajamas.  While the sandwiches are terrific, I recommend keeping it simple and just stick with the bagels.  10 out of 10.

Value: You can maybe go somewhere else and find cheaper bagels, but they are exactly just that, cheaper bagels.  The quality of these bagels could demand almost any price but they are reasonably priced. 4 out of 5.

Service/Cleanliness:  The Bagel Man has to be the nicest man in the food business in the East Valley.  He always greets you with a smile.  He loves to interact with the customers . . .but his supporting staff lately has dropped the ball.  The last time I was there, one of his employees begun to take my order and walked away mid-way.  She went to the back and after waiting for a few minutes, I just left. 6 out of 10.

Atmosphere:  It was it is - its a bagel place and I don't thing there really needs to be anything else, right?  3 out of 5.

Overall:  I feel there service has really gone down lately.  If every employee there was just like he Bagel Man himself, this place would be an easy 5 star place!  23 out of 30 points, 3 out of 5 stars.

I have lived on the east coast my entire life until I relocated here 2 years ago. I had given up on finding the bagels I craved so much out here in the desert...until now! This is the real east coast deal my friends...all is good in my world now.  Just like home w/out the snow & cold. :)

I saw the review for this place in my email and went right over. The bagels were just coming out of the oven....could smelll them the whole way home....got bagels with cream cheese...OMG! The bagels & the cream cheese were delicious!! Ive been looking for a place like this in AZ forever!!! YOU GOTTA TRY IT!

So, I hobbled my broken-footed rear-end into this place after getting a couple of amazing deliveries through door-dash. The place is TINY and it was getting pretty hot in there but, with the exception of the heat, I felt like I was time machined back to when I worked at JFK airport and it was my turn to pick up our regular order of bagels from the tiny shop just downstairs from our office.  You could almost say this guy is like a "Bagel Nazi" in the most complementary way but I think he's more like a "Bagel Whisperer."  He creates work-of-art bagels and has to train the uneducated customers.  In front of me, a guy with the whole-arm tattoos and a forward-facing Coyotes cap read off his orders (no orders are "taken" they are just spoken and relayed to the back kitchen).  He read, "One everything bagel with the bread dug out."  The owner first just looked at him like he was speaking a foreign language, and then said, "Why would you wanna do that?"  The Coyote fan said, "It's for my mother in law."  The bagel man had a serious look of disdain on his face and said very little after that.  The next guy had a little kid with him and said, "One toasted plain bagel with cream cheese..." and the Owner interrupted, "These bagels are very hot, you don't need to toast them."  The guy was about to speak again and he said, "TRUST me."  I had to speak up, "Trust him," I said.  

These bagels brought me back to those days in Queens when the bagels were so fresh that the idea of toasting them was,sacrilege.   While I was waiting a good 20 minutes in line, all but three types of bagels were sold out and two pans came out to replace two types.  I'm sure this seems like a bad thing to some people but when I see bagels being brought out and being sold out constantly, I know that whatever I end up with is going to be insanely good.  Go  here!  And try read-up on and respect,  "Bageletiquette."
Good bagels for Phoenix. Much better than Einstein's or Chompies.

Love the Bagel Man - although some of the kids he has making the sandwiches can be slooooooooooooow, the food is tasty and the bagels are the perfect amount of crusty outside and tender inside that makes me miss NYC some kinda bad.  My husband and the owner chat about New York every time he goes in there, reminding us that there's more to life than grab your food and go - this is a neighborhood joint and repeat visitors are remembered and appreciated.

Although we typically go there for bagels and bialys (they run out QUICK!), the sandwiches are killer as well, particularly the Reuben.  The place is pretty small and in a nondescript shopping center on Elliott, so you'll probably want to grab your food and go.  Perfect for mornings when you want breakfast in a hurry and fast food joints aren't on the menu.

I'm an everything bagel kinda guys and heck if you're into it go for the lox with the Worx.  

This is the best bagel in Phoenix.

-New Yorker
Best bagels outside new York or jersey. Great job bagel man!!!

Just like Jersey bagels!
Love that I can get my old favorite, Salt Bagel with Veggie Cream cheese.
I took a star off for not having Light CC and the drink selections are pretty lame.

We love this place!  The bagels are so soft, even after they are toasted.  We usually get the egg, bacon and cheese on onion or jalapeno and they are delicious.  The service is always prompt and the guy that is always at the counter (I'm assuming he is the owner) knows tons of people that come in by name and he is always friendly.  I've been to other bagel places at 10am on a Saturday, and they are all out of the good bagels for the day.  That never happens at The Bagel Man.  They have a good selection throughout the day and replace flavors as they run out.

The owner is very passionate about his bagel's-- and cou van taste the difference.  My husband and I love getting everything bagels with bacon, egg, and cheese.  The restaurant is small and not very atmospheric, but the breakfast food is great & served quickly.

Best bagels in town - hands down!! Friendly owner is very welcoming and accommodating. Atmosphere is NOT why you go here so don't be turned off by the aesthetics; you're there for the food, which is top notch.

Been here before to get bagels for a customer. They are as close as you can get of the New York style ones, which I had once. They are really busy in the morning but always have a good number of fresh bagels. The owner of the place is usually helping customers.
I have been eating here since this place has opened and it is DELISH. The Bagel Man makes the bagels fresh every morning. He uses Boar's Head meats mmmm. I love this place.
The only thing better than the food is the outstanding customer service. The people behind the counter are so friendly and helpful.

The best thing about this place is not just the amazing bagels and everything else that goes on the bagels, but the people who give you your food look so happy doing it. The first time i was there, a girl helped me find what i wanted (bagel and lox) and i got excited when she said it had chickapeas. she ended up giving me a little extra and that's what got me to come back.

Stuck in a nondescript strip mall in Ahwatukee is one of the biggest surprises you will find. Are you from back East or the Midwest? Do you miss real bagels so much that when you visit home and the first thing you do is run out and buy a real bagel?  Well, the wait is over. Real bagels straight from the East are here!  

No more bread rolls shaped like bagels. Try any of these and you will know that you are dealing with a pro. Kal, the owner, owns a bagel shop back in New Jersey. This place is worth the drive. The owner is awesome. Visit this place and you cannot go wrong. 

And if you think that Einstein's brothers offers a real bagel come and check this place out and find out what you've been missing for all these years!

What a delightful visit today to the Bagelman. You can tell how much this guy loves to be in business! It's not often you can tell the passion for food and appreciation one has for their customers, but here at bagelman, the owner beams with pride and gratitude. 

As a customer raved about her lox, I sampled the tuna, relieved that it did not contain chunks of celery. I hate that! Ordered a Ruben on a bagel for my husband, but  ate half before I even got out of my parking spot!.

So much value for what I paid for a ruben, and 1/2 lb tuna. I'll never go anywhere else! Feels like home for this New Yorker! 5 stars!

Okay so easily the best bagels in the valley! Seriously the bagels are top notch! Five star worthy!

However I have to rate it a bit lower because of the service. It seems like anytime I go there and the actual Bagel Man(the owner) isn't there the service is absolute crap... 
This morning we went and the Bagel Man wasn't there.  We ordered five bagels toasted with cream cheese. Pretty easy right? Well we ended up with only four, and on two of them there wasn't even enough cream cheese to spread around. I am sure they would have corrected it, but we were traveling for the day. We didn't discover it until later down the road. 
My moral of the story: check your stuff before you go, and don't count it being right the Bagel Man himself isn't there. 

Again I can't express how good the bagels are. They are simply the best!

Fantastic bagels!

I want to give this place 5 stars, based on the bagels, but my experience there was a little off, so I'm reserving it at 4 for now.

I had a strong craving for a bagel sandwich one day at work, so I decided to check out this place. I walked in and wasn't overly impressed with the place. It's a little run down and not the cleanest place. It's a small place, with only a couple of tables (but there aren't many people sitting down to eat here, I suppose). I came around 12:30 or 1:00 in the afternoon, and I immediately noticed there were not many bagels left in the racks. The group before me got the last of a couple different varieties of bagels, so I was pretty limited with my options.

I was thinking breakfast bagel sandwich, but I ended up going with one of the lunch sandwiches instead. Cinnamon raisin was the best of the remaining options, in my opinion, so I went with it. It was perhaps an odd combination with the red peppers and turkey on my sandwich, but oh well. When I got my sandwich, the bagel had been perfectly toasted. The texture was great! A little crunch on the outside, and nice and tender on the inside. This bagel truly was great. The sandwich toppings were decent, but as it should be at a bagel shop, the bagel was by far the star of the show. I'm definitely going to come back for more, and I may just do that cinnamon raisin bagel again for a sandwich, because it really was good.

I definitely will be back for a breakfast sandwich. There is little better for breakfast than a nice bagel sandwich. And with these bagels, I can only imagine...

The service was friendly, but spotty. When I ordered from the cashier, he kept gazing off in different directions and seemingly forgetting what he was doing. He definitely seemed distracted. I had to remind another of the guys of what I had ordered a couple of times. But in the end, I got what I ordered, and it was great.

Had I had more bagel options and the service been better, this place is a 5. I'll give it another chance in the future.

Thanks, Bagel Man!
We live in Gilbert and made the 25 minute trek to The Bagel Man and it was worth it, you won't be disappoint the best bagels in the valley and the homemade cream cheese is awesome!
Just had "The Rich and Famous" on an everything bagel. The everything bagel = life. That is all.

I saw this place on yelp and had very high expectations for a quality bagel place that beats out Einstein Bagels.. This place definitively exceeded expectations!

The bagels were so soft and moist and flavorful and on top of that the customer service was excellent. The cook gave us a mini tour in the back where they boil the bagels in house fresh before baking them! 

I ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese and a small coffee and my boyfriend got a cheese bagel with butter. Both of us ate for under 7 bucks and we left with full happy tummys :)

Been traveling for 6 hours. We were hungry for breakfast, but didn't want fast food. IHOP also didn't have a great rating so luckily we found this place.

Had a great breakfast bagel sandwich. It was and very satisfying.

The line was out the door, but it was worth it.
Freshest bagels in the valley. Worth the drive to south Phoenix! Reminds me of a New York deli, it's busy, and delicious.
Great bagels, great sandwiches and nice staff.  But get in early cause they will often sell out.

1st time here and I'm very impressed! Authentic NY style bagels that are moist and delicious! I was born on the east coast and my family lives there, so I'm very particular about foods like bagels, pizza, soft pretzels, and seafood. Not just any will do! This east coast girl (at heart) approves. I got a traditional bagel and lox and it was so good! And HUGE! I had to take half home.

And the customer service is great as well. I was greeted promptly and warmly. They made me feel as if I had been coming in for years. They also seemed to know all their customers that came in. I love to see that. 

My only negative comment is that it was so hot in there!

I will definitely be back!
Best bagels EVER!  I go in every Friday morning, everything is so fresh and the owner / employees are so friendly ?
Great bagels and so nice! Get 'em to go because dining room is warm. The veggie cream cheese is delicious! The whole wheat bagel was yummy and my kids adored the plain with cream cheese!
Simply the best bagel in the east valley and possibly the entire valley. Chewy, with a wonderful crunchy shell. The everything bagel toasted with scallion cream cheese is perfection.

If I were just talking bagels here we'd be at a 5 star. This place has some of the tastiest bagels I've come across here in the valley and they are all made fresh on premises using the old NY boil and bake. The Bagel Man himself seems to be working as a jack of all trades up front serving customer and working the bakery. 

I was pretty impressed that the selection of bagels included some classics like salt (my favorite) and pumpernickel rye along with some unusual recipes including walnut multi grain (will be trying this) and chocolate chip. 

My gourmet lunch sandwich ingredients couldn't really improve upon the perfectly cooked salt bagel they were placed upon. The sandwiches are piled with quality deli meats and cheeses and the 'gourmet list' included a choice of macaroni salad, chips or potato salad all for $5.50. I tried the macaroni salad, which was the  and it was very okay, also heavy on the mayo and light on flavor.

I am pretty happy to have another friendly option for breakfast around the office and will back for more salt bagels as well as to try the lox soon.
Damn. Flew in from Detroit pretty much just for these bagels. They were unreal and I felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode.

Headed out on a business trip and didn't have enough time to make breakfast so I looked up
some local shops that made breakfast foods.

Line for this place was long which is typically a good indicator that it's good. Line moves extreme quick to my surprise and I ordered the sausage egg and cheese on a raisin bagel.

Not only was it ready in less than 5 minutes but it also was still warm 25 minutes after getting to my destination where I could sit down and eat it.

The only reason I gave this 4 stars and not 5 is because they don't allow you to place phone orders. 

Other than that I recommend you give this place a try as their food is on point!
I've never had a bagel as good as the everything bagel here! This is such a nice place, kinda hidden away in the corner of a strip mall in an old Baskin-Robbins.

Seriously the best bagels I've ever had. My husband and I love this place. We took the kids and fed all 4 of us (with drinks) for $20.00. My favorite is the bacon, egg, and cheese on a cinnamon raisin bagel. The coffee is great too. We've moved now but we'll still make the drive because this place is amazing.

The Bagel Man has certainly earned that title and easily at that. The attention to detail of his craft is second to none in the entire state of Arizona. Hands-down the best bagel sandwich I have ever had in AZ. 
I ordered the bacon, sausage, egg and cheese sandwich on a pumpernickel rye bagel. Yes, pumpernickel rye. Not the average bagel, this one was expertly crafted and baked to perfection. The sausage was flavorful and of great quality. The bacon is thick and crispy with incredible flavor that's apparent in every bite, not that soggy "bacon" that's served at other places. This bacon was hearty. It's easy to tell that they use real cheese and they have high quality meats. The cheese was thick and melted into everything that was in the bagel. The eggs were just right, not too greasy, not too salty. Everything in the sand which was just perfect. As I said, best bagel sandwich in AZ.
The coffee is piping hot, just the way I like it. Not extra bold... smooth flavor but still certainly delivers that "kick" that is needed in the morning!
Definitely coming back to try the Lox on an Onion Bialy bagel and after that I must explore their lunch menu. Well deserved Five Stars for the best bagel sandwich in AZ!

This place is seriously the best in AZ! I had the everthing bagel with lox cream cheese and it was fantastic. I have never had a lox spread but it might be better than a regular lox (less of a struggle to eat). The owner was very friendly and seemed to know a lot of the other customers by name which isn't surprising because after one visit you will definitely become a regular!

I love the bagel man, my family comes from the east coast and we always love the breakfast sandwiches there. This is the best bagel shop in Arizona. I've lived here for 25 years and I love eating, trust me.

Bagel Man, you rock! I've visited this place two times now, and I have been very pleased each time. The bagels are super authentic, the real deal. Chewy, flavorful and totally fresh. The Bagel Man himself has been behind the counter on both of my visits, and he's super friendly. He bakes and boils the bagels himself and the quality shows. On my first visit a few months ago, I ordered the Sexy sandwich on a pumpernickel bagel (my favorite!), which if I recall, was a sandwich wiith turkey, havarti and roasted red peppers among other things. I got a combo which included a drink and a side, I chose the plain Wise potato chips. It was all tasty and fresh. On my second visit, I just went with a toasted pumpernickel with cream cheese and an untoasted everything bagel to go. I also noticed the big black and white cookies in the pastry case, so I had to throw one of those in as well. The bagels were top notch as usual, and the black and white cookie was good too. I'd never had one before but immediately thought of Seinfeld when I saw it. These cookies are more akin to half of a whoopie pie (very cake-like) iced in simple vanilla and chocolate frostings. I didn't ask if they were made in-house, but they may be. My one and only gripe about the place is the ambiance. It's in a strip mall so my expectations weren't that high but it would go a long way in increasing the inviting nature of the place if they had some music playing. All in all, if you're looking for authentic, chewy bagels, look no further than the Bagel Man!
Amazing Mom and Pops bagel shop. The bagels are so fresh and the customer service is great!

First time here while I'm in the area pet sitting. The owner and staff are super friendly and our breakfast bagel sandwiches were fresh, hot and delicious. Good coffee too. I will be visiting here from the North valley for sure. My husband and I are the only ones eating in as everyone else has been to go. Tomorrow I'm looking forward to the honey walnut raisin cream cheese on a cinnamon raisin bagel.  I really enjoy the simple decor and old school vibe.

I'm from NY and this place is right up there with a good old NYC bagel with a schmear!  It's a taste of home, quick & easy, super friendly, and not expensive at all. Thank you Bagel Man for knowing what life is
Delicious! Friendly owner and staff, great breakfast sandwich on a great bagel. I'll be back, as the owner promised I would.
Stopped by here on a whim. Bagels and cream cheese are fantastic, staff are pleasant, will be coming here again.

By far the BEST bagels in the area.  The owner is a native NY (actually NJ).  He flies in his crumb cake in from a NJ bakery - it is Delish.   Great breakfast choices and sandwiches for lunch.  Worth the short wait in line.  Update on 8/30/15:  still delish!  I am getting a little frustrated that during my last three visits I have had issues with my order being correct.  I had them at 5 stars but took one away.
Great quality bagels and lunch meat! Love that they put oregano on the lunch bagels and are always so kind to give me extra. Delicious place to eat!!

My coworker brought in bagels and cream cheese from this place today. Oh My Goodness! The bagels were so fresh! They were still warm from being made and the bagel itself was a big portion. Everyone in the office was in awe with these bagels. There were two types of cream cheese: Veggie and lox. I had never tried lox before today and am now in love. It does not have a super strong smoked taste which is good. The veggie is also delicious and actually has veggie chunks including carrots and cucumbers. The egg bagel was fabulous. I can't wait to go to the location and check out more menu items.

I drove really far to try these because of the reviews hoping for a bagel like back home. Sorry. Not even close. They are more like real bagels than supermarkets or Einstein, but alas, not as good as the worst NY or NJ bagel place. Chompies is better but only slightly.
Best Bagels in the world. Add butter and cream cheese increases the cost. Fresh and hot every morning.

Best bagel I've ever had. Amazing how the dough is so springy, yet no sign of that glue texture one can end up with in a bagel. Made to perfection. I was too busy eating mine to snap a photo, but that hole in the middle? It doesn't exist because they don't skimp.

More of a to go type place.  Limited seating inside and out. Staff was friendly and helpful.  I got a bagel chicken sandwich.  Think I might have been happier with just bagel with cream cheese but still good!

great bagels
good crumb cake, but too much powdered sugar drowning out the crumbs
friendly service
the owner is from NJ
Black and White cookies imported from Brooklyn
These bagels are great! Its been awhile since some thing tasted like NY,but this guy has got it going on.Breakfast sammie's are fantastic.Well worth the drive.

Decided to grab a quick breakfast here, tried to call in but they don't do phone orders which is a bummer but still decided to give em a shot.  

Ordered a sausage, egg, & cheese on a honey wheat bagel. 

Employees are friendly, was a good breakfast sandwich. Don't think you could go wrong with a breakfast sandwich though. But fast service was a plus esp since you can't order ahead. 

Good choice for a quick on the go breakfast
This is a very nice little bagel shop and Cal is a very sweet man who cares about his customers. The food is good, not great, but is a nice place to go and get a bagel in the AM.

The bagels are good an i would go back but the best bagels in Phoenix is back east bagel are great southern an Mc Clintock  and better price as well for a baker dozen ..  Chompies are good too an little cheaper if you order butter  bagel an if you go Weds you get 18 bagels for the price of a baker dozen.But i still go to the bagel man because it's closed to where i live.
This was the best bagel I've had all year.And for a plus the workers were so kind. That's the reason that it's the best ever bagel

Best bagels in Phoenix! Delicious, fast and friendly service. I've had several different items from the menu but what prompted me to write this lovely review is the bagel I just had for breakfast which is a plain bagel toasted w/ veggie spread! I love this place.
Friendly atmosphere and staff.  I got a bagel sandwich and it tasted good, but wasn't my favorite.  This spot does seem pretty popular, though!
I was born and raised in New York. These are the best bagels I have ever had. It feels like New York inside The Bagel Man. I love it.

Used to live in NYC and I miss the bagels more than anything! This shop definitely has that Brooklyn feel to it, the bagels were flavorful and the cream cheese was the perfect consistency. We've tried a few other places and this one seems to hit the Saturday morning bagel craving the best :)

The bagels are always fresh, I didn't even know bagels could taste so good. Often times they are so warm I don't even get my blueberry bagel toasted. 
The sandwiches are soooo good...

I love small little local shops like this one!! All the staff was very friendly and asked us a couple times how everything was. They had great variety and the bagels were being baked fresh as we waiting for our food. I had the bagel with lox and cream cheese and it was amazing!

These people are from new jersey, like me, and are the only authentic bagel place in the valley. They never overload their bagels with cream cheese and their price for lox and cream cheese is the lowest in town! Even after being frozen these bagels still maintain a crunchy outside and soft inside. They never taste dense or heavy, these are 1 of a kind.  It's a cozy small family operated place go and will not be disappointed!  Just listen to all the compliments you'll hear during EVERY visit.  You'll see why the Bagel Man is the man, OPEN EVERY DAY OF THE YEAR.
The bagels are great. Small place, Boars Head meats and plenty of it on my sandwich

I have been coming to the Bagel Man since he first opened and they are the Bagels I ever ate. The bagels are boiled and then baked to perfect soft chewy inside and crunchy on the outside. I love the everything bagel  as it has the perfect balance  of salt, garlic onion, poppy and sesame seed.  
The lines can get long at times and confusion happens with the orders at times  and I overlook it as it's part of the Bagel Man experience.
Very good soft bagels!  Owner a little ill mannered though but still enjoyed the bagel schmear.

For all you NYC bagel brats out there, this is your new favorite place! I never thought that I would be able to find bagels that even compare to those in NY, but The Bagel Man delivers. They often have a line out the door but are so quick. Coffee and breakfast for two is about $10. Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, schmear oozing out the sides, and sliced down the middle. Reminds me of my favorite city!

I cant believe this place has been open since 2000! The best giant bagels in Az! The last time I had a Real Bagel was in NYC and this place is better! THEY HAVE THE BEST SALT BAGLE AND FRESH CREAM CHEESE!! 
It was my first visit, but no way I'm going anywhere else!!!

Much to my surprise, this was one of the two best bagels I have ever eaten, out of probably thousands all over the U.S.  Perfect combination of crunchy crust and chewy interior.  
Obviously impeccably boiled.

(The other one was at the Bagel Snack in Pompano Beach, FL)

I guess I have to leave a long ass review? but why he's from New York City and he makes bagels end of story. This is the best damn bagels in the valley go get you some I just get everything bagel toasted with cream cheese and egg when I used to eat meat I use to get bacon or sausage used to go to everyday when I was pregnant. I don't see how people waste their money at Einsteins bagel. Man I would die for a bagel right now with some coffee, reminds me of when I was in New York City.

There really isn't much to be said that hasn't already, but in case you are on the fence GO!  The best bagels of my life.  Personal favorite is the salt bagel, grab it on the morning while they are fresh and warm.  I can't encourage you enough to run to the bagel man, and get an extra dozen for everyone you love.

Now this is a real Bagel!  I love this spot...home grown NYC style, fresh, lots of cream cheese, no skimping here.   Owner is a cool guy and remembers you everytime.  Stop going to the chains and support the local man.  Regardless it's better then any other corporate joint...Trust me!

I stopped by the shopping center the other day and I almost didn't go in because the business is somewhat nondescript.  I'm so glad that I did, I couldn't believe what I was eating.  I've just come back from NYC and I thought I wouldn't find that taste again until my next trip back.  I absolutely love his bagels.  Crusty on the outside and so soft and perfect on the inside.  

I've been back three times in the last week and I am in love!  Kal is such a friendly guy and he is unguarded and warm, a real pleasure to talk with.  I've just moved to the valley and I am so glad there is an amazing bagel shop here.  Phoenix just got great!

By far the best bagel I have ever had! This man is the real deal! Genuinely cares about his business and his product. You will not find a better bagel in the state of Arizona! In most cases, the bagels do not even need to be toasted because they are so warm and fresh! My favorite is the jalapeño bagel with garden veggie cream cheese! Thank you bagel man!

Do you want the best bagel in The Valley? Well I found it for you and now you can reap the benefits. After living in Phoenix for almost two decades I have officially found a round piece of dough with a hole in the middle that deserves to be called a BAGEL. For many years I could only get my bagel fix when traveling back to New York to visit friends or family. But now finally I have found a shop in Phoenix that has not only the proper taste but also the proper texture/consistency of a New York bagel. Don't bother with other imposters claiming to have "New York style bagels."  This is the only real deal in the Phoenix metro area.

Hearty bagels NY/NJ style. Tried the cinnamon raisin which was toasted and loaded with honey walnut cream cheese . Tasted divine but was too much for one person. The place could get a little clean up but it attracts more of a fast moving regular crowd who come in for their morning breakfast bagel and don't care about the ambience or place! It's a good stop to get a quick bite.
LOVE the "Sexy" sandwich. Always nice people! REally good bialy!
Got bagels to go to eat back at our hotel. Only one order out of the four ordered were correct. Immediate fail in our book.

Not impressed. This was my first and last visit here. From the moment I walked in was not good. Two separate entrance people unsure of where to form the lines or where to order. Ordered a lightly toasted chicken salad sandwich and got it home and found it burned (so much I couldn't eat it) with barely a bite of chicken in it.  Paid way to much.
great bagels...crunchie on the outside (without toasting), soft on the inside.  Friendly staff and owner.

Best bagels I've had outside of New Jersey hands down. Took me a few years to discover this place and I'm glad I did. They know how to do it right. They also are the only ones I've seen with taylor ham (aka pork roll) out side of Jersery.

Friendly staff & service (Jersey represent!). I ordered the scrambled egg, smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers, red onions on a whole wheat toast. My fiance ordered the chicken cutlet, mozzarella, roasted red peppers on a bagel. Both were delicious and reasonably priced. Can't wait to come back when I'm back in AZ!

This place gets you in and out quick.  The bagels are very soft and they had many choices to choose from. The prices were pretty good for what you get.  They wrap it in tin foil which is nice when getting to-go. I ate my bagel sandwich 30 minutes later and it was still hot.  The Bagel Man is friendly. I don't understand why are there so many haters. Maybe people need to be more friendly and he will reciprocate.  The cook was very nice and accommodating. I have to give this place a 5 star review based on my experience which was perfect.  I suggest giving it a try once at least. Hopefully you catch the Bagel Man on a good day like I did apparently.
Very good bagel sandwiches! My husband had a breakfast sandwich and I had a turkey on jalapeño.  The staff was very friendly and recommended some great food. We took 2 to go because it was so good!

This place is just great. Cant even compare it to places like Einsteins. It's just far superior. And the prices are on point. Visit here, u won't be disappointed. Lox on bagel is awesome and what you get is excellent for the price!
The bagels are yummy and service is quick but when you are at check-out DO NOT forget to buy the coffee cake. It is the best coffee cake I have ever tasted.

I wanted to love these bagels, and give this place 5 stars, but I simply can't. Here's why: both bagels I tasted were seriously under-baked. Not a little under-baked, but squeeze-the-bread-just-little-and-it-turns-back-into-dough, under-baked. I can't give any higher than 3 stars for that baking faux pas. I get that they are turning out bagels quickly, but they needed to give them another good 10-12 minutes in the oven, minimum. Make the customers wait for quality. 

The flavor, however, was excellent. The salt bagel had the perfect amount of salt without making me feel like a blowfish, and the jalapeño bagel was jam-packed full of jalapeño flavor. You can also tell they use the boiling technique which makes them a chewy texture. If only they had been baked well! 

I did not get a sandwich, or even cream cheese, since I wanted to see if these are truly NY-style. They are...except for that one thing I mentioned 120 times. 

Maybe a bad day for the Bagel Man. I probably won't be back to find out.

Visiting out here in Phoenix and came to Bagel Man two days in a row. Had the sausage, egg, and cheese on plain bagel while hubby had lox over onion bagel. Super delish. Now that I'm back in Cali, my mouth is watering just thinking about this place. Good deal on bagels alone too!

I think this may be hands down, the best bagel I've had in AZ.  Originally from NY, I'm hard to please with this kind of stuff. The texture is like the bagels in L.I.  Crispy on the outside soft in the middle.  No one wants a dry bagel, at least I don't!  

-Cheers,

East coasters, cease your search to fill the bagel shaped hole in your belly, because this is it. Fresh, crisp, delicious. Mmmmm. The owner is very helpful and just generally seems to be a great guy. However, the place seems disorganized. I waited for the longest time to place my order and they are often out of most of their food hours before it closes. 

Nevertheless, I would never recommend any other bagel spot to someone. Good. Food.

This place isn't anything fancy, it's small but their food is ABSOLUTELY amazing, and, I will not lie, it's warm inside which I don't mind because, well fresh bagels, enough said.
Favorite visit was a couple days, I had started work at 5a, so taking my lunch at 9a is annoying because not everywhere is serving lunch at that time of day. I walked in and nervously asked the lady, should've gotten her name, if they served lunch. She smiled at me and said, "I can do anything." I got so happy and ordered "The Sexy" but with no herb mayo because I can't stand mayo, AT ALL. So she asked, "Would you like to substitute the herb CREAM CHEESE instead?" I got even more happy and asked, "You can do that?" She smiled and repeated herself, "I can do anything." Needless to say, I was super happy about it and let me just say, that SANDWICH was f*cking phenomenal. I hate 5am shifts but I would do it again because now I know where to go for a 9a lunch, permanently.

We we're staying a night at the Arizona Grand Resort and we wanted to have breakfast on our way home.  This place was a little out of our way, but it was totally worth it.  Fresh bagels out of the oven and a line out the door.  We recommend getting a bagel flavor of your choice, lox, tomatoes, onions, and capers.  This is perfection.  Their everything bagel is awesome.  We would be here every weekend if we lived closer.

Excellent bagels that tasted very much like the NY bagels we enjoy back home !

The owner is very friendly and the service is efficient .

I would definitely recommend this place :)

Omg! Being an old school Jewish gal, Arizona has garbage for bagels. I've lived here since 79, and. I had never found an authentic bagel. Until Now! Found on complete accident, through Google, craving a bagel. Wow! I sat in my Jeep, like a pig in heaven! Yum! Drool! I had two! I want more! This is my forever bagel joint! It's an old school joint! Love!
Best bagels around.. no comparison. The owner runs a great business and the food is great! Love the breakfast bagels and my kids do too. Highly recommend!

Best bagels in town. The owner is an incredible guy and so nice. He is so well respected in the community. Never disappointed when I get a bagel. Quick service for always having a large line. Love this place.
Best bagels and bagel sandwiches I've had since moving from NJ.  Rock on, Bagel Man!
Best thing I've eaten in Phoenix!  The lox are extraordinary, fresh amazing bagels!!!!  Great service as well!  Wish I could give it more stars.
So delicious. The bakers come out from the back and interact with patrons. The owner was so friendly. It was easy to tell that everyone who is part of the business of proud to be there!
Delicious freshly baked bagels! The most friendly staff around. Best bagels in the Ahwatukee area and very fair prices.

Bagels are delicious. The bread is thick and chewy, and I am definitely a fan. The owner is very friendly and staff is extremely helpful. Location is tucked away in a shopping center on the south side of Elliot Road just west of the I-10.

I live right down the street and my girls and I often ride our bikes down to the shop on Sunday mornings. The bagels are made fresh everyday, I often would see the windows all fogged with steam as I made my way to work at 5 Am in the winter. The kids love it. I usually get an everything bagel with the veggie cream cheese that they make. I actually have not branched out yet, but I will next time! It is really great when the bagels have just came out hot and you don't even need to toast them.

Quaint. Clean. And straight to the point. The staff, including owner are very friendly. Food, while limited in options, is perfect. Will return soon! I had the egg salad on the everything bagel, toasted. It was an amazing experience.
The owner is great. He made the experience really enjoyable. The bagels are sooo yummy. The macaroni salad I wouldn't recommend but the crumb cake is so amazing!

I love love love this place.  Cal and my fave sandwich maker, Patrice, are simply great people.  These are authentic bagels, definitely the best by far in Ahwatukee, and I would wager to guess in the Valley.  No sense trying others, when this place is in my neighborhood.  Stop by and give 'em a try!

Forget Einstein's! These are real bagels that hold true to their promise that they're like the bagels back east. The owner is so welcoming, and will help you with the many many options! I'll be back for sure

These are my kinda bagels, man! A no funny bussiness kinda establishment. Just great food and sweet staff. My experience here brought me back to a trip to New York.

I grabbed a lox with chive cream cheese on a toasted everything bagel to go. The sandwhich was huge and smelled fantastic! They make their own spreads and the flavor proves it. The bagel itself was fluffy and had that nice subtle salty flavor a good bagel should have.

Service was quick and the staff were friendly. Will be back to try more!
Excellent bagels (especially the salt ones) and great service! Went for my first time the other day and can't wait to get back and get more bagels.

Fast friendly service! I have been here a few times and each time I am equally impressed! Not only do the have the BEST lox bagel with capers, tomato, and onions, the service is so friendly! As a plus, they text your receipt to you, so I don't have to hold onto messy receipt with BPA chemicals!

It's true. These are the best bagels I've come across in Arizona. The bagels had a delicate and flaky exterior with a soft interior. I came across this gem when my friend, originally from Brooklyn, was adamantly searching for a bagel reminiscent of the ones he found in his hometown.  Cal, the owner, was genuine and remembered my friend and me just after one stop to his shop. If looking for a place to buy quality bagels, there will not be many other stores rivaling The Bagel Man.

This is the best place in AZ to get an authentic NYC bagel!  If you're looking for the bagel lox they know how to do it right.  Just like in NYC where they smother it in cream cheese and don't skimp on the lox.  You'll enjoy every bite.  They run out quickly so you have to show up early to get the bagel you want.  No other bagel shop I've been to compares to the size and taste of these amazing bagels from The Bagel Man.  The staff is always friendly and more than willing to help you decide on what to order.

About as close to Jersey bagels as we've had since we've been here and taylor ham too!  Only downside was they were out of some of the varieties of bagels we wanted. Can you open a place in the West Valley?! We'll be back!
Best New York style bagels....hands down! So soft and flavorful. Can't go wrong with this place.

The bagels here are extremely fresh and soft. The cream cheese is always flavorful and the texture is perfect. Beware- they will sell out. Many times, I have come here past 11 and most of the bagels have been sold. If you want the full selection, come early or on a week day! It's definitely worth the trip.
Outstanding! Reminds me of walking right into a deli in Manhattan. The staff is always friendly and of course the bagels are amazing. Try the bacon egg and cheese on a toasted wheat bagel!
These bagels are the best bagels in town. The owner and everyone who works there is incredibly friendly.

In general, I make it a habit to visit any restaurant that has a line out the door.  In fact, the longer the line the better.  Which is just what happened one sunny Saturday recently in Phoenix, when I was visiting a bucket list fabric store and (coincidentally) felt my empty tummy rumbling.  As I pulled out of the parking lot I noticed several out-of-place people standing outside a nondescript strip mall establishment. 

Who are these people?  I asked myself.  Why are they just standing...on the sidewalk...on a Saturday morning?  And then I spotted the sign above them: "The Bagel Man" it read in big red letters.  A quick peek at Yelp told me all I needed to know: it was here that I'd be stopping for breakfast.

So I parked the car and got in line.  I didn't even care what was on the other end of that line.  I just knew it would be good. 

I waited patiently, and eagerly, with the smell of fresh-baked goodness wafting past me.  I ogled the deli case, full of delicious-sounding house-mixed cream cheeses.  I thumbed my debit card as the line inched painfully forward.  Finally, it was almost my turn.  And just then, as if by magic, I heard two amazing words:

FRESH SESAME!

They were yelled from the bagel chef (er, baker?) as he tossed about a dozen puffy sesames into one of the many bagel baskets behind the front counter.  But the guy in front of me had heard the announcement too.  His forehead was practically sweating as he uttered the words "I'll take a dozen sesame."  I wanted to beg him to take pity on me!  "Give me my favorite bagel!  Please!  I love sesame bagels.  For goodness sake, I ONLY WANT ONE!"

But I didn't.  As if by fate, though, his young daughter said "Daddy, can I have a plain bagel?"  So he swapped a sesame for a plain and you know how this story ends: the sesame bagel was mine.  ALL MINE!

I got it with a thick smear of lox cream cheese, quickly ran to my car, and devoured the whole thing in about 2 minutes.  Okay, 5 minutes.  And as I proceeded towards the airport and a flight home, I regretted I hadn't gotten one for the plane ride!

Solid bagel spot. The bagels are really yummy and fresh. I got the sausage, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich. It was really good and super cheesy! The guy recommended not to toast the bagel since they were already freshly made and hot out of the oven! Really glad he did because it made the sandwich that much better. 
I didn't give the place five stars because it was so small and got really busy. There isn't really any place to wait for your to go order. It took awhile for my sandwiches and then when I said the order was mine the guys tried giving it to someone else. Maybe they can take down names when calling out the orders instead or give out numbers.

Always a great place to start your day! Bagels are fresh and made the New York way!! Once you try these bagels, you'll keep coming back!!

I always get the sausage, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel.

I heard about this place from a co-worker. It's close to my office, so I checked it out. I am a New Yorker, born and raised, and I love my bagels. This place is hands down THE BEST bagel west of the Mississippi. If you love authentic NY style bagels, search no further. Puts Chompie's to shame. Delicious bagels, friendly staff, great prices, and fast service. Please check this place out!!

The Bagel Man has by far, THE best NY style bagels in AZ. I'm from Connecticut and lived in NYC so I know what a great bagel tastes like and he's done it here. Like another reviewer said, it's not quite H&H but the closest you'll get in the desert. 

Staff is friendly, the owner is there all time and super friendly as well. I love the everything bagel with cream cheese, simple but delish!  Only caution is that it's small inside and can get crowded in the mornings. Enjoy!

I, like many others, am from New York. So I have high expectations when it comes to bagels. I moved 6 years ago to CA and could not find a single bagel place that even touched what I was used to. So I'd have my mom just send me bagels! Although not as a fresh, it was a better alternative. So, when I moved to Tempe, I was VERY skeptical to find a place that I'd like.

I looked up bagel shops on Yelp and found The Bagel Man. Many other east coasters approved so I figured I'd give it a try. I went in on a Sunday morning around 7:30am and there were only a few people there. I think I was in and out in about 5 minutes! Their customer service was fantastic!

The bagels themselves were exactly what I was hoping for. They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Tasted like NY heaven to me! 

The only downfall I had was that my bagel was a bit too over cooked and a little burnt-ish on the outside. But I bought a half dozen and no others were like that. I'd give them a 4.5 stars if I could. I certainly will be going back!!

Love this place..I think it's the best bagel place in AZ. I lived in nyc for 13 years and loved bagels and those are the closest to nyc style I had in AZ...everything bagels with bacon and eggs is delicious

Every time I visit Phoenix (hometown NYC) I gotta grab some bagels from this guy. His bagels taste like they came straight from New York's best bagel joint. They are fresh, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and huge. He is always there greeting customers (super friendly guy) and ensuring consistency and quality. If you like bagels, this is a must visit place.

This place is amazing. AMAZING!! Maybe I am just a bit green and have never experienced a true bagel before (I am a native Phoenician) but Bagel Man seriously has the best bagels I have ever tasted in my entire life. 

I stop by here once a week or so before work and usually get an egg and cheese sandwich on an everything bagel, or a cheese bagel toasted with veggie cream cheese. The prices are very, very reasonable. I think they charge me less for coffee than Circle K, and the coffee is much better. I have never been by when the coffee is cold or stale.

The bagels are not the only reason this place earns 5 stars though.. The staff at this place are absolutely delightful. They are all so nice and friendly and work very hard to get you your order as quickly as possible. The owner is always so happy, and it is really neat to see how someones business can really succeed with love, dedication and hard work. 

The only thing I want to caution Yelpers about is if you plan on hitting this place before work, maybe call in your order. Sometimes it can get a bit chaotic here, and you wouldn't want to be late to work because you were waiting for your bagel!

Best bagel I've had in a long time. Better than any I've found in California. May be the best bagel I've had more than 100 miles from the Atlantic Ocean. Thanks bagel man. Oh, and I hope your tukee stops hurting ;-).

best bagels in the valley, best in phoenix, best in AZ, best in the west, best outside NY and NJ! in other words, i loved it! came in yesterday just passing by (i was the brunette east coast girl). loved the doughy-ness, nice plump bagels. there seem to be a few different kinds of "real" NY bagels and these are one of them.  if you don't see me in here every day, it's only because i will get ADDICTED! coffee was not perfect. maybe i didn't get a fresh batch.
I tried this place for the 1st time last week. WHERE have they been my whole life. Best bagels ever, great customer service. I drive out of the way just to get ny fix!
