This place is a hidden gem for people who do not live in the area... I'm a huge bagel fan but the bagel sandwiches take it to a whole new level! I got the everything bagel, jalapeño cream cheese, bacon, and egg sandwich and was absolutely thrilled! 

The family owned feel and service here is outstanding... everyone was so nice and helpful and  made the sandwich perfectly! We are excited to continue coming to the bagelman and inviting our friends to try this hidden gem!

Happy to have found a local, East-Coast feel for a bagel shop. Their sandwiches are great. I usually get egg, bacon, and cheese on a plain bagel...toasted. Mmmmmm.

The big guy who runs the place tends to stare down other big guys but maybe that's an East Coast thing too. 

Small area, but fast service.

Was told about this spot from a coworker and it did not disappoint.  Had the lox breakfast sandwich and also ordered a turkey sandwich for later - both were on a sesame bagel.   Great prices and very tasty. Will be returning soon!
Nicest staff that I've encountered in a very long time. Reasonable prices. Speedy service & the food is amazing!! I love this place!!

Great bagels.  I had the roast beef on a salt bagel.  Great!  It was 1pm and I had the last salt bagel.  You might need to get their earlier if you are set on a specific type.  

He has a great reputation and the bagels are sold quickly by the dozen.

It is a small shop, bagels made onsite. I would call ahead if you need a large order.

The food deserves 5 stars, but the layout of the shop and lack of information for first-time visitors on how to order took 1 star away. The bagels are delicious and pretty large. I had lox and eggs on a plain bagel and my son had a chocolate chip bagel with plain cream cheese. I will definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

Hi to my fellow foodies...

This just might be my shortest review yet!

Good bagel.. Good cream cheese... Awesome lox sandwich.... 

Loved that they opened at 5am so I could pick up bagels for work but I went there this morning after missing my bagel for a month or two and they were CLOSED!

It seems they DO NOT OPEN UNTIL 6am... 

Although I enjoy their bagels I don't enjoy them enough to go completely out of my way...

This was my breakfast go to place.... So sad they open later now....

So long Bagelman.....

Bon appetite'

Honestly, you can taste that everything was fresh. It may take a little longer than chains - as everything is made fresh in the back by 1 person - but it's worth it! The everything bagel was fresh out of the oven, warm and was soft with a crunch exterior. SOOO GOOOD. And don't get me started on the veggie cream cheese. You could taste the veggies and could actually make out what was in it. 

The owner was running the register and was super sweet telling everyone happy Friday. 

I'm never going to another bagel place again.
I had a plain bagel w/ plain cream cheese and it was delicious! Staff was kind and helpful and the prices were very affordable!

A coworker made a stop on his way to work and brought in a dozen for the office. I must say I haven't had this much amazing goodness of a bagel in a long time. Even a plain bagel is so light fluffy and the outside has crustiness that is perfect. They are also not your average size bagels, they are huge. The shmear omg I cannot even describe it, so good I can even just eat it all by itself. I haven't had this good of a bagel since I lived in NY. Gonna have to walk in and check this out myself. I heard there was a bit of a line in the morning, but all worth it.

I visited the Bagel man in the afternoon because I was craving a really good REAL bagel. Being from the East coast, ever since moving to AZ the bagels and bread and pizza crusts don't taste the same. I know it's got to do with the water somehow but let's just say THANK YOU BAGEL MAN! I do not live close by, but I will be coming back for sure. I tried their sesame bagel, pumpernickel, cinnamon raisin bagel,YES I took a few home and they were all delicious! Exactly the REAL bagel I've been looking for. Also, the veggie cream cheese was so good, I regret not buying more of it because it didn't last in my house. Highly recommend the bagel man for anyone who loves a good bagel. PS, the next day my bagels were still great and delicious. Many places the bagels are ok the first day and the next day hard as a rock, but not these. Perfect once lightly toasted :)

Absolutely delicious! This is how a bagel should taste. The bagel man boils the bagels! We ate a sesame bagel with egg and cheese. Our son ate a croissant. Coffee was fine. Definitely will return again for one more breakfast sandwich while in AZ.

My absolute favorite! The staff is fast and awesome. The owner is great and super friendly. But the bagels. The bagels. They are to die for! Hands down the best I've EVER had! Great job Bagel Man, you've nailed it. 

I always get a cheese bagel toasted with jalapeño cream cheese smear, so delicious. Their sandwiches are are great for breakfast and lunch. 

If you are in the area do yourself a favor and get acquainted with the Bagel Man!

It's been a little while since I've been here, but I seriously love the bagels they serve. I normally just get un-toasted bagels to go. Definitely try their Lox Spread! Got it on a toasted everything bagel last time - awesome! The coffee cake is also super moist and perfect. 

I see that some people have critiqued the service. I agree that it can be a little awkward, but I've always gotten what I wanted and been served well. One time a girl working there messed my order up, but the Bagel Man stepped in, fixed my order, and let me keep the stuff she messed up. The awkward part was that he yelled at her about it in front of me. Either way, the bagels are bomb!

I'm from the motherland of Bagels...Brooklyn.  We take our bagels seriously.  I think all Einstein locations should be burned down.  

By far, Bagelman's are the best bagels I've had in AZ!  I used to live across the street and went often.  The owner is very nice.  My only word of caution is that they can take a really long time to fill your order.  One time I went looking for an onion bagel and was told that they would be 'right out'...20-25 minutes later I finally got my bagel.  After that I would just take whatever they had ready.

This place is great.  I am not sure if this place reads Yelp reviews or what... but anything negative that was said about this place is not the case today.  The place was spotless.  very very clean.  The people behind the counter were incredibly friendly and attentive of the customers that came through the door.  I was immediately greeted upon entering (even when he was helping another customer) and after ordering, my food was promptly made.  

The bagels were great.  Nice size.  Crispy on the outside, doughy in the middle.  Significantly larger than other bagel stores.  The lox were fresh.  The cream cheese you can tell is homemade. 

Overall, this will be the place I get bagels from now on.  This east coast Jew has found a winner.

Thank you bagel man.

Unassuming small mom and pop type place with nothing fancy about it. There are minimal amounts of seating inside and outside. You get your own coffee and sit down. Line was to the door but was fast. I had a bialy and butter. I asked for it well done. I wont ding them because apparently "well done" is a term that never made it to the future as time progressed from the late 80's into the 90s and onto today. However, they did manage to execute a really amazing bottom crust. The bread substance of the bialy was thicker than it should for a bialy and definitely had too much body (dense). The coffee was typical non-gourmet coffee...not the best. Due to the low cost and the most amazing crust I have had in a decade, I bumped a 3 to a 4.
Freshly made bagels every day with a New York flair definitely a great spot for breakfast or lunch! Personal favorite is the "show off"
These are the best bagels I've ever had, including bagels from NYC and Montreal! The shop is kind of hidden away, but it's worth the search. Very quick, very tasty.

Things that are awesome: 

staff!! First and foremost are so helpful and friendly

Bagels: are on point! They 100% have that New York bagel feel.

Cheese: that cheddah life!! The cheese was delicious 

Lacking: eggs....which is the star of a breakfast bagel show. I asked for runny fried eggs and got well cooked, dry ones.

It's a sad, sunny day in Arizona. I never get bagels while traveling because good ones are hard to come by.

I would try the lox from here next time but never an egg sammich again.

Best East Coast bagel in Arizona (and I'm from Jersey). Not sure if there's something in the water, but the bagels are PERFECT - light and fluffy on the inside but with the perfect crisp on the outside. Top favorites: lox bagel, chive cream cheese, everything bagel, but really everything is delicious.

To top it off, The Bagel Man himself is the sweetest guy. Make sure to grab a slice of coffee cake on your way out!

The bagels are the best in the Southwest! What takes this over the top is the customer experience. Words cannot credit this establishment.  Try and you will be hooked! There may be a line, but that's what happens when it's  all good!

Easy, fast, affordable breakfast.

I ordered an iced coffee for $1.99 and a breakfast bagel with scrambled eggs, bacon and cheese. (The eggs are actually real everyone!)

They have a selection of fresh bagels to choose from.
I tried the cheesy one. It was soft with just the right amount of crispyness from roasting it.

The best bagel by far you'll find around here, nothing else even compares. They've fixed the issue of writing down large orders and it's really made a difference in the quality. Love the bagel man and will return

The ONLY bagels I have found that are like those back East in NYC... And I've lived all over the country. Baked fresh daily and delicious.  PLUS... He has salt bagels!  If you love bagels and you're in the Ahwatukee/Chandler area. Then THIS is the place.
Best bagel I have had in a very long time. Yum!

I stop here almost every morning.  The customer service is phenomenal and the bagels are always fresh. The cream cheese and bagel selection is consistent and fresh. I love and I'm obsessed with this place.

I was disappointed. I had a bagel with cream cheese.  I should have gotten the cream cheese on the side because it was way too much for me.  The bagel I had seemed a little overcooked.  Too brown.  Overall, I was not very impressed.  Maybe I hit them on an off day.

The most amazing bagels I've had since New York. The staff and owner are very friendly, and always spend time to visit with the customers while they're waiting for their orders. The line moves very fast, and totally worth the brief wait.

Definitely delicious. I hear it's an authentic New York bagel, but it doesn't seem that different from most other bagels, aside from Einsteins but that's the wonder bread of bagels. I love their everything bagel with lox cream cheese. Yummy!

Already a line at 6:20 in the morning but definitely worth the wait! The bagels have a soft, fluffy texture (even a day after). Schmear was the perfect topping for the warm, fresh breakfast snack. I got a baker's dozen for my co-workers and they loved every bite! The Bagel Man was a hit. I will keep coming back.

The best bagels hands down. At my work we get bagels once a month and for some odd reason they found this place and we had so many people agree that when compared to any other bagel shop this one beats them. Who ever did the bagel run had to drive an additional 15 miles just because the bagels were better then the closer bagels store.
I've been search for five years now. The Bagel Man is the real deal. Finally, my fellow New Jersey-ite has brought the bagel to Phoenix. Gett'um hot on Sunday morning.

These are probably the best bagels I have ever had. 10/10 would recommend! There are tons of amazing bagel and cream cheese options, along with breakfast sandwiches. These bagels are so fresh that the owners told me not to order them toasted. I listened to him and I will definitely go back! Great service, very quick and nicest employees. Wonderful place!

Update on my review, still 5 stars! Love this place and come several times a week.  I have no idea why you would go to any other bagel place in a 5 mile radius, well except on Mondays when they are closed.

My suggestion is a Bacon, Egg, and Cheese on a Cinnamon Raisin, it will change your life.  The Boy loves their Scrambled Eggs with Lox sandwich which is an amazing deal.  His sandwich is always loaded up and feels like it weights pounds.  The Boy and I always say we wish we would try their lunch sandwiches but I love their bagels by themselves so I stick with that.

They have had a minor change in prices so the older photos of the menu are out of date but don't let that stop you from visiting.  All the Points to Bagel Man!
Easily the best bagels in Phoenix.  Lofty statement I know, but try for yourself and you'll say the same thing.  Well done Bagel Man

Easy 5 stars! We showed up for a couple bagels to find out that they were sold out but had a fresh batch baking that would be done in 15 minutes. We ran to the store and returned to fresh baked bagels unlike any other bagel we've ever had..literally melt in your mouth. 

I will never be able to have a store bought bagel again thanks to the bagel man. 

On another note the fresh made cream cheese is the perfect accompaniment. Do yourself a favor and get the everything bagel with scallion cream cheese, you're welcome. 

Owner (I think) helped us and was great. 
Already thinking about my next bagel experience at the bagel man.

There is nothing that compares anywhere else in AZ! One bite and you are instantly in NYC. Also the only place you can get an egg bagel!! BEC on an egg bagel is pure heaven! Worth the drive from anywhere!!! (Caution: closed on Mondays!)

I've been here multiple times and I have to admit a boiled bagel is so much better than a baked bagel. The owner convinced me to skip toasting the bagel. I was surprised at the outer crunch and inner chewiness. Delicious! My only complaint is sometimes they skimp on the cream cheese, which made me disappointed, because it is so amazing. Hands down, best bagel I've ever had! I'm so glad this little gem is close to my home!

This place is amazing! I get the everything bagel with bacon, egg and cheese. And it's always amazing! I go early in the morning so it's always a fast and easy trip for me. Everyone is always really nice and easy to please.

Make sure you get here early! They sell out of bagels throughout the morning, and the best ones always go first. They make their own cream cheese in house and they are all amazing. Their breakfast bagel sandwiches are also very good, and a great price for the quality that you are getting. Their staff is super personable, and helped recommend items on the menu for us to get and cream cheese/bagel pairings. Can't wait to go back!
I sent my son there to get me a cream cheese everything bagel and a plain blueberry bagel. both were very yummy. love bagels. so many are not authentic. this place is...

Adventures in Bagels. As often as they may be good, they are not good. Inconsistency is not a good thing in business, especially for a restaurant. In any event, I do not believe they are first boiled like a real N.Y. bagel should be. If they are, something else is wrong.
At the busiest times they may be out of the most popular styles. Not good when you are anticipating your meal.
On one occasion, Owner was out of change and actually told me he would "Catch me Next Time:. Really?  If anything, he should have offered to undercharge me by the difference, and not the opposite.
Also, if you need a receipt be ready to give out your email address, cause that is the ONLY way to get one. Not even sure this is Legal!
Should be given the option of a hard copy at time of service, OR, emailed at your choice.
Bagels may be good at times, but, too many other important things are off putting.

For all of you New York and jersey folks looking for a taste of home, this is the place. Bagels are excellent. Ordered a sausage and cheese on everything. Was pretty solid... Then I talked to the owner who is from New Jersey and incredibly friendly, mentioned I was from jersey and he dropped the hammer "we have Taylor ham". He offered to replace my sandwich... But I said nope, let's double down and get another one. 

For you jersey expats who think you can only get a TEC on an everything within the confines of the garden state, give this place a shot.

Might need a 12 step program for this place!  Came for  lunch yesterday and brought the family back for breakfast,  everything was so good, took a few more and some cream cheese to go! Can't wait to come back for the Rueben!
 Exit 143B on the Parkway (it's a Jersey thing!)

Awesome, awesome, awesome! Great bagels and really awesome customer service. Super friendly staff. The one complaint I have is that the place is an oven. Good god, I am surprised they haven't gotten heat stroke! Thankfully I get my order to go, mostly! Otherwise, you can't beat this place!

These are legit, old-school quality New York style bagels. The bacon egg and cheese bagel sandwich and The Sexy are my favorites. The bagels are all awesome and fresh and is just a matter of preference what you choose. Great,  prompt service,  delicious menu, friendly staff, good prices, what more can you want? This is my go-to bagel place, every time. I am never disappointed. Solid 5 stars.

Best bagel place! It can get packed so expect a line and try to get there early in the day so you're not stuck with the leftover bagels that, although delicious, might not be exactly what you planned on ordering.

I Iove going to the bagel man!!! The bagels are always on point! I go at least once or twice a week for breakfast. However, lately the customer service has been crappy. Ever since the African American man (the bagel man) left, this new man offers the worst customer service. When I asked when the bagel man was coming back, he replied "IM THE BAGEL MAN THIS IS MY SHOP IM THE BAGEL MAN!!" I love the food but the lack of customer service is something I can't overlook. Sorry bagel man! Call me when the real bagel man returns!
If you haven't been here for a bagel, you're missing out. It a small shop with a big New York feel. Bagels and everything on their menu is top notch.
Makes a Jersey Girl so happy and proud to eat somewhere that understands how bagels should be made. The Bagel Man gets 5 stars without any hesitation. Great food for a great price. Can't be beat!

The bagels were delicious. It was warm and toasty in there as well. Plus, the eggs were real - which was awesome.

However, they use American cheese on the egg and cheese sandwiches and it really ruined it for me.

Would go back again, and ask for no cheese!

I have never been a fan of Bagel until I met the Bagel Man. Yum, Yum, Yum! These are extremely dangerous due to their addicting nature. I've limited my visits to once a week and spend the other six thinking about my next visit. See you in a few days!
Great east coast bagels. A no frills store that does it right.  Thanks for a great breakfast.

Went to The Bagel Man for the fist time, very disappointed.  The bagel is just a glorified bread roll, not boiled and baked as advertised.  We ordered 2 bagel and lox sandwiches,  but they had no flavor, no capers, no onion and no lemon. Won't go back.

I tried this place out yesterday for the first time. Let me start by saying that my review is probably worth nothing, because there are some 160 reviews and the average rating for this place is four and a half stars. That speaks volumes to me. So here is what I have to say: I have never had a bagel or even known that a bagel could be as perfect in every way imaginable until yesterday. I kid you not, everything from the texture to the taste is astonishing. I stayed in Time Square for quite a while and have had my fair share of bagels from places all over the country and NONE of them compare to here.
SOOO good! Go here all the time, get the salt bagel with lox spread everytime! Super friendly owner as well :)

The breakfast sandwiches are always to die for. There will always be a steady flow of people because everyone loves this place, but you get your meal in a timely manner so don't let the lime length detour you. Amazing staff. Plus I love their coffee.

Fresh made bagels restocked every few minutes. Owner is the cashier and obviously the Bagel Man. I've recently become a fan of Lox and theirs is awesome, also can't go wrong with any of the Breakfast sandwiches, I love that they have peanut butter and jelly. Service is awesome and super speedy.
Great bagel shop. Love the sandwiches and breakfast. Everything is made to order and delicious. Can get crowded but that's because it's successful.
Went all out with sliced lox, tomato, onion, and capers. Reminded me of Sabels in NYC. Great service too!

This place has the best bagels in AZ hands down. Real handmade bagels from back east not rolls passed off as bagels line other chains. Owner is a great guy and learned his trade from some of the best in the business. Great place for bagels and sandwiches.

This is the most basic of the basic bagel shops.  While at a work function, a coworker & I got up crazy early one morning to go on a long walk before our breakfast meeting.  That long walk turned into an insanely long walk and I feel like we walked to the next state - long story short we were hungry and wandered into some sort of industrial park with not a coffee shop to be found.  We kept walking and found a small strip mall with the only open business at the time... The Bagel Man.  We popped in for two coffees and bagels.  The Bagels were good, but I'm from the American North East - we have high standards for our bagels...so there is good and then there is GOOD.  This was good.  The coffee was basic, the service was friendly and really quick.  It is a tiny little place with very limited seating so if you don't get in early, you are likely to have a tough time finding some place to sit.  Out door seating is available - but do you really want to do that in the Arizona sun?

The bagel was really good.I order a everything bagel with jalepeno cream cheese.  I went around 1pm and the bagel still tasted fresh. I asked for it lightly toasted, she toasted it perfectly. My only issue was too much cream cheese but thats no big deal would 10/10 recommend.
The best bagels we ever had.  Also, the only went gave us a crumb cake that was so delicious!  Must try if you are in town.
Great bagels, and being from NYC's Upper West Side I should know.

The place smelled great and the sandwiches we bought and ate there were very good (I love the rye)!  The bagels, however, tasted too bready for me.

I spent the last 45 years in the Atlanta area, where there are several excellent bagel delis.  The bagels here made me wish for Atlanta, not Phoenix.
